name: 1 Inch Punch
instructions: Rim the edge of a flute with sugar.
Combine all the ingredients into a shaker filled with ice cubes, except the sugar and the chilli flakes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with chilli flakes.

name: 50 Days
ingredients: 5 lemon balm leaves (alternative: mint, basil, lime or lemon mint)
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the apple, in a shaker containing the ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with diced green apple and mint leaf.
Combine rum and anise-flavoured liqueur in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Add tabasco.
Top up with sparkling cider.
Garnish with an apple slice and star anise.

name: 77th Heaven
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the sprig of mint, in a shaker ﬁlled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a wine glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the sprig of mint.
Combine all ingredients, except for 2 chilies, in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a chilled martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with 2 chilies.

name: A sweetheart of a drink
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice, combine all ingredients.
Shake vigorously for several seconds.
Pour into a martini glass.
Garnish with whipped cream, if desired.

name: Absinthe Cocktail
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the star anise, in a shaker ﬁlled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the star anise.

name: Absolutely Refreshing
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lemon quarter and the maraschino cherry.

name: Adam's Apple
instructions: Heat all ingredients in a pot, without bringing to a boil.
Serve in a toddy glass.
Decorate with a cinnamon stick and apple wedge.

name: Africa colada
instructions: Rim a highball glass with cinnamon.
Combine all the ingredients, except for the pineapple slice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the pineapple slice.

name: African Don Pedro
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker, except for the chocolate syrup.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into a highball glass.
Garnish with chocolate syrup.

name: African Espressini
instructions: Mix the coffee and sugar.
Combine all the ingredients, except for the chocolate shavings, in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old fashioned-glass.
Sprinkle with chocolate shavings.

name: African Martini
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.

name: African Mint
instructions: Pour the marula cream in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add the mint liqueur.
Top up with milk.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Sprinkle with the chocolate shavings and garnish with the mint leaf.

name: Almond Coffee
instructions: Frost the rim of a toddy glass with sugar.
Combine the Canadian whisky and almond liqueur in the toddy glass.
Top up with hot coffee.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with whipped cream and slivered almonds.

name: Almond Cosmo
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a chilled martini glass using ice strainer.
Garnish with fresh cranberries.

name: Almond Cosmo, punch version
instructions: Combine all ingredients except cranberries in a punch bowl.
Serve in chilled martini glasses.
Garnish with cranberries.
Pro tip
To keep punch cooler longer, add a few frozen cranberries to each glass.

name: Almond Cranberry
instructions: Combine the almond liqueur and cranberry juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange wedge.

name: Almond Sour
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice cubes, combine all ingredients, except Angostura and lemon zest.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a balloon or cognac glass using an ice strainer and sieve.
Add dash of Angostura.
Garnish with lemon zest.

name: Almond Splash
instructions: Combine almond liqueur and orange juice in an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with an orange wedge and a basil leaf.

name: Almond Warmer
instructions: Combine the vodka, almond liqueur and hot chocolate in a toddy glass.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with whipped cream.

name: Aloe Fizz
instructions: Combine vodka, aloe juice and club soda in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lemon slice.

name: Amarante
ingredients: 10 mL (1/3 oz.) lime cordial (or lime syrup)
instructions: Combine the armagnac and lime cordial in a highball glass containing a few mint leaves.
Using a muddler, gently press the mint leaves to release their flavour.
Add the ice cubes.
Top up with the lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

name: Amaretto sour
instructions: Rim an old-fashioned glass with granulated sugar.
Combine the almond liqueur, lemon juice and granulated sugar in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with half lime slice.
Pro tip
For something a little different, try using 30 ml (1 oz.) of Rose’s Lime Cordial instead of the lemon juice and sugar.
Did you know

A member of the sour family, the Amaretto Sour is famed for its sweet and sour taste, which is enhanced with a touch of almond. Sours made their debut in The Bartender's Guide, the world’s first-ever cocktail book. Published in 1862, this handbook was written by Jerry Thomas, who is considered the father of the cocktail.

name: Amberamba
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1 / 2 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine the amber rum, rum and coconut beverage and pineapple juice in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: American Grog
instructions: Combine rum, lemon juice and sugar in a toddy glass.
Place the lemon wedge, cinnamon stick and cloves in the glass.
Add the boiling water.
Stir a few minutes using a mixing spoon.
Did you know:

This cocktail is attributed to Admiral Vernon, known to his friends as «Old Grog» because of his grogram jacket. In 1740, Vernon ordered his crew to drink water mixed with rum, which was added to the drinking water to prevent algae from forming on their long voyages. The crew dubbed the drink «Grog.»

name: Americano
instructions: Did you know

The Americano was created just as prohibition began. When travelling abroad, Americans had the opportunity to try drinks that were banned at home. When travelling in Italy, they tasted Campari, but found it too bitter. This prompted their Italian bartender to combine it with red vermouth, which masked the bitter taste. He called his creation the "Americano".

name: Anis Fresco
instructions: Combine the anise liqueur, cranberry juice and lemon juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with the lemon wedges.

name: Anise Cosmo
instructions: Pour the anise-flavoured spirit, cranberry juice and lemon juice into a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lemon slice.

name: Anise Tea
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for one star anise, in a toddy glass.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a star anise on a cocktail pick.

name: Aniseedy Cranberry
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the lemon, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a half lemon slice.

name: Aperi-tiki-colada
ingredients: Orange slices or pineapple chunks for garnish
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice, pour all the ingredients.
Shake vigorously.
Serve in an old-fashion glass.
Garnish with an orange slice or pineapple chunk.

name: Aperol Spritz
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the orange slice, in a wine glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the half orange slice.

name: Apollo Surprising
instructions: Combine the scotch, grenadine syrup and orange twists in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Soak a sugar cube in scotch and place it on a fork balanced across the top of the glass rim.
Light the sugar cube aflame and place it in the cocktail.

name: Apple and Spice
instructions: Combine the apple juice, cloves, one cinnamon stick and the lemon zest in a saucepan.
Heat over low heat until hot.
Add the dry gin.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Pour into a toddy glass and add the maple syrup.
Garnish with the cinnamon stick and apple slices.

name: Apple Colada
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a martini glass.
Garnish with apple slices.

name: Apple Fireball
instructions: Combine the cinnamon-flavoured whisky liqueur and cider in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a shot glass using an ice strainer.

name: Apple Martini
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) apple beverage (like Apfel Korn)
instructions: Combine all the ingredients except the apple slices into a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the apple slices on a pick.
Pro tip
For a sour version of the Apple Martini, try using 60 ml (2 oz.) of sour apple liqueur instead of the apple juice and apple beverage.

name: Apple pie
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) vanilla and cognac liqueur
1 slice of fresh or dried apple
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the apple slice and cranberries, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the apple slice and cranberries on a cocktail pick.

name: Apple Racer
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) maple syrup cream liqueur
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the cinnamon, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a chilled martini glass using an ice strainer.
Top with cinnamon powder.

name: Apple-icious
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) herb liqueur (like green Chartreuse)
instructions: Combine the apple brandy, herb liqueur and apple juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vogorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into a highball glass.
Top up with the club soda.
Garnish with the lemon slice and cherries.

name: Argentine pomelo
ingredients: 90 ml (3 oz.) grapefruit juice (red or pink)
1 grapefruit slice cut in two parts
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Aristocrat
instructions: Combine the dry gin and rosemary syrup in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a flute using an ice strainer.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary.

name: Asian Punch
instructions: Combine all ingredients (except a few lychees for garnish) in a punch bowl.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish each glass with a lychee on a pick.
Pro tip:
To prepare ginger syrup, combine 4 pieces of ginger and a cup of cane syrup (simple syrup) in a pot and bring to a boil. Let cool before using.

name: Asian Punch, individual serving
instructions: Combine all the ingredients except the lychee into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lychee on a pick.
Pro tip:
To prepare ginger syrup, combine 4 pieces of ginger and a cup of cane syrup (simple syrup) in a pot and bring to a boil. Let cool before using.

name: Asian Sun, individual serving
instructions: Combine rum, citrus liqueur, nectar, lime juice and ginger ale in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into a highball glass containing ice.
Top up with ginger ale.
Garnish with fresh fruits.

name: Asian Sun, punch version
ingredients: 1 litre (34 oz.) mango or apricot nectar
Fresh fruit (orange, pomegranate, lime, star fruit, etc.)
instructions: Combine rum, citrus liqueur, nectar, lime juice and ginger ale in the punch bowl.
Cover and let steep about 2 hours in refrigerator.
Add ginger ale immediately before serving.
Serve in glasses filled with ice cubes.
Garnish with fruit (orange, pomegranate, lime, star fruit, etc.).

name: Auntie's punch
instructions: Pour the rum, pineapple juice, maple syrup and lime juice into a pitcher.
Refrigerate for four hours.
Add the sparkling wine and ice cubes.
Mix gently.
Pour into highball glasses.
Add raspberries and lime slices.

name: Auntie's punch, individual serving
instructions: Pour the rum, pineapple juice, maple syrup and lime juice into a highball glass.
Refrigerate for four hours.
Add the sparkling wine and ice cubes.
Mix gently.
Add raspberries and lime slices.

name: Automnic
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) homemade or store-bought tonic syrup
instructions: Pour dry gin and tonic syrup in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top with tonic water.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with fruit.

name: Autumn Punch
ingredients: 1 litre (4 cups or 3 cans) store-bought iced tea (like Nestea)
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the ice cubes and lime twists, in a pitcher or punch bowl.
Cover and refrigerate until serving time. (While not essential, preparing the mixture a few hours ahead will yield more intense flavours.)
Squeeze the lime twists over the punch and drop them into it.
Add the ice cubes just before serving.

name: Azur Mania
ingredients: 7 ml (1/4 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Place the 1/3 of celery stalk in a shaker and crush using a muddler.
Add the ice cubes, vodka and cranberry juice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with tonic water.
Slowly pour the citrus liqueur down the inside edge of the glass to create a layered cocktail.
Garnish with a lime slice.

name: Azure
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Rim a margarita glass with sea salt.
Combine all the ingredients, except for the lemon slice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lemon slice.

name: B28
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender, except for the ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.

name: B52
instructions: In the following order, pour: coffee liqueur, Irish cream liqueur and citrus liqueur.
Flambé for one minute.
B52s are meant to be drunk all at once.
Pro tip
B52s are made directly in a 2 oz. shooter glass. Pour the ingredients into the glass over the back of a spoon.

name: Baby Blue
ingredients: 10 ml (1/3 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Combine the lemon juice and pineapple juice in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into four shot glasses using an ice strainer.
Combine the tequila and citrus liqueur in the same shaker without rinsing it or removing the ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the shot glasses.

name: Backyard tea
instructions: In a highball glass containing a few ice cubes, pour the rum, iced tea and lemonade.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the half-slice of lemon.

name: Baileys Blastoff
ingredients: Iced treat like a fudge bar or marshmallow
instructions: Combine Irish Cream liqueur and long espresso in a Mason jar.
Add fudge bar.
Top up with chocolate milk to cover fudge bar.
Stir using fudge bar.

name: Banana Daiquiri
instructions: Peel the halved banana and cut into pieces.Combine all ingredients in the blender except the banana slice.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a margarita glass.
Garnish with the banana slice.
Pro tip
For something a little different, try using citrus-flavoured rum instead of white rum.

name: Banana Mama
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) rum and banana beverage or banana flavoured rum
instructions: Combine rum and banana beverage, pineapple juice and cranberry juice in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing ice using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a cherry.

name: Banana split
instructions: Place all the ingredients, except for the maraschino cherry, in an electric blender.
Blend on low for 5 seconds, then on high until desired consistency.
Pour into a martini glass.
Garnish with the maraschino cherry on a cocktail pick.

name: Bananarula
instructions: Combine all the ingredients into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.

name: Bangkok Breeze
instructions: Pour the white rum and ginger ale in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: Basil Jay
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) vodka (regular or raspberry flavoured)
15 ml (1/2 oz.) raspberry liqueur (or other liqueur flavoured with red berries)
instructions: Put four of the basil leaves, eight of the raspberries, the sugar cane syrup and the lime juice in a shaker.
Crush lightly with a pestle.
Add the vodka and raspberry liqueur, fill with ice cubes and shake vigorously for8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a chilled martini glass.
Grind green peppercorns onto the drink and garnish with tthe basil leave and the raspberry on a pick.

name: Basil Park
instructions: Combine raspberry syrup, lemon juice, basil leaves, gin, and a few ice cubes in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour in wine glass and top with sparkling water.
Decorate with basil leaf.

name: Beach
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
The juice from one lime wedge
instructions: Pour all the ingredients into a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a shot glass using an ice strainer.
Pro tip
You may find it easier to make two servings at once, in which case simply double the ingredients (add 8 ml (1/4 oz.) for all ingredients requiring a splash).

name: Beau-Tea
instructions: Combine the vodka, raspberry-flavoured vodka, lemon juice and honey in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with iced tea.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the slices of starfruit.

name: Bell
instructions: Place the coriander, basil and cucumber in a shaker and crush using a pestle.
Add 3 ice cubes, the dry gin and vermouth.
Add two lime twists and honey.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Place 2 ice cubes in a martini glass.
Strain into the martini glass using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Garnish with a lime twist on a cocktail pick.

name: Bell Tower
instructions: Combine the hazelnut liqueur, white rum and citrus liqueur in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with pineapple juice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add the grenadine syrup.
Garnish with an orange slice and a pineapple slice.

name: Belle Bulle
instructions: Place all the ingredients except the Prosecco, lavender, and lime, in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously.
Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
Add the Prosecco.
Garnish with a lavender stem and a slice of lime.
Recipe by Jonathan Thériault, mixologist

name: Bellini
instructions: Peel peaches.
Cut peaches in half and remove stones.
Pulverize peaches in electric blender until they puréed.
Spoon 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) peach purée in a flute.
Pour sparkling wine slowly into the flute.
Mix using mixing spoon.

name: Berri-UQÀM
instructions: Combine 3 lime wedges in a highball glass and crush using a muddler.
Add the ice cubes, vodka and syrup.
Top up with club soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a basil leave and a lime wedge.

name: Berry Blush
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) homemade or store-bought rhubarb juice
instructions: Place the raspberries in a shaker and crush using a muddler.
Add all other ingredients, except for the flower and the rhubarb stalk.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Garnish with an edible flower and rhubarb stalk.

name: Berrylicious Margarita
instructions: Combine the vodka, lemonade and raspberries in a blender containing ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a margarita glass.
Garnish with a raspberry and a mint leaf.

name: Big Apple
instructions: Combine the whisky and apple juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the apple wedges.

name: Bitter Folly
instructions: Combine the vodka and grapefruit juice in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Slowly pour in blackcurrant liqueur to create a layered cocktail.
Squeeze the grapefruit zest over the glass to release the oils.
Garnish with a sage leaf.

name: Black Hurricane
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine the rum and coconut beverage and cola in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a cherry.

name: Black Ice
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) whisky and maple liqueur
instructions: Combine the vodka, whisky and maple syrup liqueur and cranberry juice in a shaker ?lled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with 2 or 3 fresh red cranberries.

name: Black Jack
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.

name: Black Russian
instructions: Combine all ingredients in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Pro tip
This simple cocktail with surprising flavours is sure to please... as long as you get the mix right. It's also important to pour the alcohol directly onto the ice cubes.

name: Black Spice
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the mint and lime, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the sprig of mint and lime slice.

name: Black Tzar
instructions: Pour coffee liqueur and vodka over ice cubes in a highball glass.Top up with cola.
Garnish with orange slices.
Pro tip
Add the soda at the last minute ensure the drink is bubbly enough.

name: Black Tzar, punch version
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large punch bowl.
Serve in glasses filled with ice.
Garnish with orange slices.
Pro tip
Add the soda at the last minute ensure the drink is bubbly enough.

name: Black Velvet
instructions: Pour the beer into a flute glass.
Add the champagne.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Black Widow
instructions: Combine dark rum, white crème de menthe and ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass.
Stir with a mixing spoon.

name: Black widow Cosmo
instructions: Squeeze the lemon peel over a shaker containing the ice cubes.
Place the lemon peel in the shaker.
Add vodka and cranberry juice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Pour the crème de cassis into the centre of the drink.
Garnish with a ground cherry.

name: Bling
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except the orange slice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes, using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the orange slice.

name: Bloody caesar
ingredients: A few drops of red Tabasco sauce
instructions: Frost the rim of a highball glass containing a few ice cubes with the lime and celery salt.
Add all the ingredients, except for the vegetables.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with the onion, the aspargus and the carrot on a cocktail pick.
Pro tip
For a trendy cocktail, swap your highball glass for a mason jar and garnish with a vegetable skewer rather than the more traditional celery stalk.
Other tip: Use spiced Clamato juice, then leave out the Tabasco or Worcestershire. For a more intense experience, replace the Tabasco with horseradish.
Did you know

To commemorate the inauguration of an Italian restaurant in 1969, Calgary bartender Walter Chell created Bloody Caesar. Chell took his inspiration from the Bloody Mary, but since clam sauce was on the menu, he spent a few weeks crushing some of these molluscs, until he managed to achieve the perfect balance with the tomato juice. More Bloody Caesars are sold in Canada than any other cocktail.

name: Bloody Mary
instructions: Combine ice cubes, vodka, tomato juice, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, celery salt and black pepper in mixing glass containing ice.
Mix using mixing spoon.
Strain over glass using an ice strainer.
Rinse celery stalk and place in glass.
Pro tip

People tend to think of the Bloody Mary as a drink that is hard to make. If you want to recreate the original taste, spice the tomato juice yourself using the original ingredients (and keep away from ready-made spiced tomato juice blends). You can make a Virgin Mary (the alcohol-free version of the Bloody Mary), by using 40 ml (1 1/3 oz.) more tomato juice instead of the vodka.
Did you know

Three different stories attempt to explain the name “Bloody Mary.” Some claim it is a reference to Mary Tudor Queen of England, whose reputation as a bloody queen earned her this cocktail namesake. Others maintain that a bartender named it after a girl named Mary who frequented the Bucket of Bloody Club in Chicago. The third theory is that Ernest Hemingway came up with this name, in honour of his wife, Mary Welsh, who bemoaned his heavy drinking.

name: Bloody Orange
instructions: Combine the vodka and bitter liqueur in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with orange juice.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange wedge.

name: Blue Devil
ingredients: 20 ml (2/3 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue Curaçao)
instructions: Combine all ingredients and ice cubes in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a slice of lemon.

name: Blue Ice
ingredients: 22 ml (3/4 oz) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Mix together all ingredients, except for the citrus liqueur, in a stainless steel bowl.
Put the bowl in the freezer for about three hours.
Every 45 minutes, stir with a fork to break up the forming ice layer.
Add the citrus liqueur to the mixture.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Pour into chilled martini glasses.
Garnish each glass with an edible flower.

name: Blue Lagoon
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue Curaçao)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes, except for the starfruit slices.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with starfruit slices.
Pro tip
Add lemon-lime soda to this recipe to obtain a Blue Lagoon Highball, which has a sweeter taste.

name: Blue Muscat
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) blue citrus liqueur (like curaçao bleu)
instructions: Combine the muscat, citrus liqueur and litchi juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with tonic water.
Garnish with the half-slice of lemon and litchi.

name: Blue Passion
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) blue citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the orange wedge, in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with an orange wedge.

name: Blue wave
instructions: Combine ingredients in a glass with ice.
Garnish with a few slices of fresh fruits.

name: Blue Wind
ingredients: 75 ml (2 1/2 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the tonic water, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.

Pro tip
Rum-soaked raisins:

Place raisins in a bowl, cover them with rum, and leave to infuse for a minimum of four hours in the refrigerator. Use them in cocktails or in a dessert. They’ll keep in a covered container in the refrigerator for several weeks.

Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.

name: Buttercup

name: Caipirinha
instructions: Cut the half lime into four pieces.

Add crushed ice cubes, cachaça and cane syrup.
Mix using a mixing spoon.
Did you know...

The Caipirinha came to be in the 1800s, first made by Brazilian slaves. They drank boiled cane sugar juice called garapa and mixed it with cachaça, a type of spirits made from sugar cane. For flavour they added spice and fruit juice. One of these mixes, the batida de limao, which is made with lime, is today's Caipirinha. And where does this name come from? It’s a contraction of two terms: caipira, which means peasant, and curupira, a forest demon who, according to legend, appears to people who’ve had too much to drink.

Did you know:

In North America, football and hockey games are often associated with tailgate parties. These gatherings bring out throngs of diehard fans to stadium and arena parking lots, where they gather around the open tailgates of their vehicles to consume grilled delights and alcoholic beverages.

Pro tip
For a Cosmo with character, replace the cranberry juice with 10 ml of cranberry syrup.
Did you know:

Created in the 90s in a swanky bar in San Francisco, the Cosmopolitan quickly became the lady's cocktail par excellence. In 1996, Madonna was photographed with one of these pink drinks in hand, and consequently the Cosmo gained popularity in New York and London. Two years later, the Cosmo made its first appearance on Sex and the City, sparking international popularity.

instructions: Combine the Canadian whisky and Irish cream liqueur in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.

name: Creamy Chocolatini
instructions: Combine the Irish cream liqueur and the vodka in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the chocolate shavings.

name: Creamy Chocolatini, punch version
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large punch bowl.
Pour into martini glasses.
Garnish with the chocolate shavings.

name: Creamy Pink
instructions: Combine the strawberry cream liqueur and milk in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a half strawberry and a mint leaf.

name: Criss-cross
instructions: Pour all the ingredients, except for the raspberries, into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the 2 raspberries.

name: Cuba Libre
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) white or amber rum
instructions: Pour the rum into a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes.
Top up with cola.
Add squeezed lime wedge.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Pro tip
Kick it up to a Cuba Libre Supreme by replacing the rum with peach and bourbon liqueur.
Did you know:

One of the world's most popular cocktails, this drink was put together in a Havana bar during Cuba's second War of Independence (1895—1898). A captain entered the establishment and ordered a shot of rum, a side of Coca-Cola and a slice of lime. When a group of soldiers asked him to make a toast, he raised his glass and offered the war cry that had so effectively motivated his troops, «¡Cuba libre!»

name: Cucumber Collins
instructions: Place the cucumber slices in a highball glass and crush them with a muddler.
Add a few ice cubes.
Pour the rest of the ingredients into the glass except the cucumber spear.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the cucumber spear.

name: Cucumber Gimlet
instructions: Place the cucumber slices in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Pour the rest of the ingredients.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Cupidon
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker full of ice cubes.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.

name: Cupidon, punch version
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large punch bowl.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses filled with ice cubes.

name: Daiquiri
instructions: In a shaker, pour ingredients over ice cubes.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Filter over a martini glass using ice strainer.
Garnish with lime slice.
pro tip
The key to the daiquiri is to shake it vigorously with ice, so that the mix gets good and cold. But be careful not to let the ice in the shaker melt into the drink.
Did you know

The Daiquiri was named after an iron mine in Cuba. After visiting the site, two thirsty engineers combined the only ingredients they had: rum, lemons and sugar. “It Serves for a Rum Sour,” said one. The other replied, “That name is not worthy of a cocktail as fine and tasty as ours. Let's call it the Daiquiri!”

name: Daiquiri, punch version
instructions: Combine the rum, lime (or lemon) juice and cane syrup in a pitcher and add the ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Pour into chilled martini glasses.
Garnish each glass with a lime slice.
Did you know:

The Daiquiri was named after an iron mine in Cuba. After visiting the site, two thirsty engineers combined the only ingredients they had: rum, lemons and sugar. «It Serves for a Rum Sour,» said one. The other replied, «That name is not worthy of a cocktail as fine and tasty as ours. Let's call it the Daiquiri!»

name: Dark 'N Fluffy
instructions: Combine the vodka, irish cream liqueur and cream in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the marshmallow and cocoa powder.

name: Dark and Dreamy
instructions: Combine the coffee liqueur and rum in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with cola.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Decadence
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) chocolate liqueur (like Lejay Lagoute)
instructions: Combine strawberry liqueur and crème de cacao in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a wine glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish with a chocolate-covered strawberry on a cocktail pick.

name: Decadent Pear
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Decorate with a pick.

name: Diamond Martini
instructions: Pour all the ingredients, except for the club soda and blackberry, into a martini glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with the blackberry on a cocktail pick.

name: Dirty Martini
instructions: Pour gin, vermouth and olive brine in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into a martini glass using ice strainer.
Garnish with lemon zest or a few olives.
Did you know:

Invented in Hollywood between 1998 and 2002, this cocktail was created after some female movie stars called for a version of the Dry Martini that was less strong and had a more pronounced olive taste. Some savvy bartenders modified the recipe by adding olive brine to the mix. The result: a hazy concoction that could only be called a Dirty Martini.

name: Double Diamond
instructions: Steep the green tea with the cinnamon stick in a toddy glass containing the boiling water for five minutes (or the time recommended on the sachet).
Add the dry gin, lemon liqueur and honey.
Garnish with the lemon slice.

name: Doudou
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the field berries, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with field berries on a cocktail pick.

name: Downhill
instructions: In a old-fashioned glass containing a few ices cubes, pour the rum and pomegranate juice.
Top up with the beer, to get a good head of foam.
Garnish with an orange twist.

name: Dracula
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.

name: Dry Martini
instructions: Combine the gin and vermouth into a mixing glass filled with ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with olives on a cocktail pick.
Did you know:

As the signature drink of figures like F.D. Roosevelt and Ernest Hemingway, the Dry Martini was so popular at the end of the 1930s that it became the subject of some saucy Hollywood lines. The most famous was uttered by Peaches O'Day, played by Mae West, in the movie Every Day's a Holiday, «You really ought to get out of those wet clothes . . . and into a Dry Martini.»

name: Dublin
instructions: Combine the Irish cream liqueur and club soda in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Durango
instructions: Combine the tequila, almond liqueur and grapefruit juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with tonic water.
Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.

name: Earthy delight
instructions: Combine the cream liqueur, vodka and almond liqueur in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a cherry on a pick.

name: Eggnog
instructions: Combine rum, brandy egg yolk and honey in a electric blender.
Blend until smooth.
Bring milk to boil.
Pour all ingredients into a toddy glass.
Add pinch of nutmeg or cinnamon.
Serve hot, warm or cold.
Did you know:

In Europe in the 30s, eggnog was traditionally served all winter long, and particularly on Christmas night. This drink was a combination of milk, cream, sugar and egg yolk, flavoured with nutmeg or cinnamon. The Americans added rum, which at the time was known as «grog.» Thus the cocktail became known as «Eggnog!»

name: El Diablo
instructions: Combine the tequila, crème de cassis and ginger ale in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lime wedges.
Did you know:
This Californian cocktail was mixed for the first time in 1946 by legendary restaurant owner Victor Bergeron, who is also said to have created the refreshing Mai Tai cocktail.

name: Electric
instructions: Combine whiskey, citrus liqueur, lime juice, peach wedges and 5 mint leaves into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour mixture into a highball glass and top up with tonic water.
Garnish with mint leaf.

name: Electric Jello Shot
ingredients: 80 ml (2 2/3 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue Curaçao)
instructions: Pour 120 ml (4 oz.) of water into a pot and bring to a boil.
Add the gelatin powder.
Add the vodka, citrus liqueur and the rest of the water.
Pour into shot glasses.
Refrigerate for 3 hours before serving.

name: Emerald Tea
instructions: Steep the green tea in a toddy glass containing the boiling water for five minutes (or the time indicated on the sachet).
Add the lemon liqueur.
Garnish with the lemon slice.

name: En mode cocktail
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the orange slices, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the orange slices.

name: Enchanted Garden
ingredients: 250 ml (8 1/3 oz.) homemade or store-bought green juice
instructions: SERVES 2
Rub the rim of two highball glasses with a lemon wedge.
Dip the rims in a mixture of salt and fennel seeds.
Place ice cubes in the glasses.
Divide the dry gin, green juice and hot sauce between in each glass.
Garnish with cucumber slices.

name: Enchanting apple martini
instructions: Rim the glass with lemon and dip into cinnamon sugar.
In a shaker, pour all the ingredients, including the lemon slice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the dried apple slice.

name: English Toddy
ingredients: 180 ml (6 oz.) freshly steeped black tea
2 lemon slices studded with 2 or 3 cloves
instructions: Pour the Canadian whisky into a toddy glass.
Add the honey, lemon slices and black tea.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Espresso martini
instructions: Combine the coffee liqueur, vodka and espresso in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the cherry on a cocktail pick.

name: Etna
ingredients: 330 ml (1 can) orange or clementine San Pellegrino
instructions: Gently crush using a spoon the orange cubes into an highball glasse.
Add the vodka and cinnamon liqueur.
Add ice cubes.
Top up with San Pellegrino.

name: Evening Breeze
instructions: Pour the citrus liqueur and blueberry juice into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Pour the vodka and orange juice into another glass and stir with a mixing spoon.
Slowly pour the contents over the back of the mixing spoon and into the highball glass.
Garnish with the orange wedge.

name: Evil Eye
ingredients: 25 ml (3/4 oz.) citrus liqueur  (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Chill the martini glass in the freezer for 1 hour. Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds. Strain into the chilled martini glass using an ice strainer and a sieve. Garnish with a bug shaped candy.
Pro tip:
For a sensational effect, serve on a piece of dry ice.

name: Exotic Fruits Margarita
instructions: Combine the vodka, mango and ice cubes in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a margarita glass.
Add a dash of grenadine syrup.
Garnish with lime slices.

name: Exotic Martini
instructions: Combine the vodka, pineapple juice and crème de cassis in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the pineapple slice.

name: Exotic Orange
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the half slice of orange, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the half slice of orange.

name: Exotic Raspberry
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) raspberry liqueur (like Sour Puss)
instructions: Combine the vodka, raspberry liqueur and pineapple juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a pineapple slice and leaf.

name: Eyeball soup
instructions: Pour the fruit beverage in a highball glass filled with ice cubes. Top up with club soda. Slowly pour in the grenadine syrup to create a layered cocktail. Place candies inside lychees and add them to the cocktail.

name: Fall Bubbles
ingredients: 8 ml (1/4 oz.) sugar cane syrup (simple syrup)
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the ginger ale, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a champagne flute using an ice strainer.
Top up with the ginger ale.

name: Fall chalet
instructions: Combine the dry gin, cranberry juice and apple juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the apple slice and cinnamon stick.

name: Fall flavours
instructions: Combine genever gin, apple liqueur, lemon-lime soda and Angostura in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with lime slices.

name: Fall Harvest
instructions: Combine dry gin and apple sauce in a shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds. Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer. Top up with sparkling cider.

name: Fall nectar
instructions: Combine the honey liqueur and apple juice in an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with apple slices.

name: Festive Coffee
instructions: Frost the rim of a toddy glass with sugar.
Pour the marula cream in the toddy glass.
Top up with hot coffee.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the whipped cream and cinnamon stick.

name: Festive Punch
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a punch bowl. Pour into old-fashioned glasses and garnish with fruits and mint leaves.
Pro tip:
For a truly sparkling punch, mix the juice and the spirits the morning of, and add the fizzy ingredients at the last minute.

name: Festive Punch
ingredients: 6 tbsp honey diluted in 90 ml (3 oz.) of water
1/2 cup frozen balls of honeydew melon
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a pitcher, except for the ice cubes, fruits and tonic water.
Add ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add half the fruits.
Use the other half to prepare fruit skewers.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses.
Garnish glasses with fruit skewers.

name: Festive Punch, individual serving
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with fruits and mint leaves.
Pro tip:
For a truly sparkling punch, mix the juice and the spirits the morning of, and add the fizzy ingredients at the last minute.

name: Field berry martini
instructions: Place 4 strawberries in a shaker and crush with a muddler.
Pour in the vodka and maple syrup.
Add the ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with a strawberry.

name: Fiery Mint
instructions: Combine the mint leaves, honey and hot water in a shaker and crush with a muddler.
Add the ice cubes, vodka and herb liqueur.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the mint leaves and honeycomb.

name: Fiji
ingredients: A few drops of blue curaçao
instructions: Pour curaçao in a highball glass containing one ice cube. Set aside.
Combine the gin, pineapple juice and one sprig of basil in a shaker containing two ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds or until mixture is foamy.
Carefully strain into the glass to create a layered cocktail, using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the other sprig of basil.
Pro tip:
* Can be replaced with thai basil, available in many supermarkets.

name: Fiji Martini
ingredients: 15 mL (1/2 oz) citrus liqueur (Blue Curaçao or similar)
instructions: Pour the gin, liqueur and lemon juice into a shaker filled with the ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

name: Firecracker
ingredients: Sparkling sugar for rim (sugar that sparkles when it comes into contact with liquid)
instructions: Wet the rim of a margarita glass with lemon juice.
Dip rim in plate containing sparkling sugar.
Combine dry gin, citrus liqueur, lemon juice, and syrup in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a margarita glass using an ice strainer and sieve.

name: Fireworks
instructions: Combine rum, cola and tabasco in a double old-fashioned glass (or a snifter) containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a chili pepper and a lime slice.

name: Fizz Studio
instructions: Combine the brandy, dry gin and lemon liqueur in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Add the lemon juice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with tonic water.
Add the grenadine syrup.
Garnish with a lemon slice.

name: Fizzy
instructions: Combine the first four ingredients in a electric blender and blend until you have a smooth purée.
Pass through a fine sieve.
Spoon into a flute, then top up with sparkling wine.

name: Fizzy vodka lemonade
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the lime slice, in a tulip glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lime slice.

name: Fizzy vodka lemonade, punch version
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the lime slice, in a pitcher containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with using a mixing spoon.
Pour into tulip glasses.
Garnish each glass with a lime slice.

name: Fjord
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine the herbs and liquids into an old-fashioned glass containing the ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Flavored peach
instructions: Combine the rum, peach liqueur and lemon juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Add the cane syrup.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with club soda.
Sprinkle with cinnamon.

name: Fleur de Cassis
instructions: Pour the crème de cassis into a martini glass.
Pour the vanilla-flavoured vodka, pineapple juice and lime juice into a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the raspberries on a pick.

name: Flirty Fizz
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao )
instructions: Combine flavoured vodka, citrus liqueur and pineapple juice in a highball glass filled with ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with a pineapple leaf and an unpeeled pineapple slice.

name: Florentine Float
instructions: Combine anise liqueur and vodka in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Drop a scoop of sorbet into the drink.
Garnish with a mint leaf.

name: Floridita
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Flower Power
instructions: Combine elderberry liqueur, grapefruit juice and club soda in a rock glass or old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes.
Garnish with a lemon slice and frozen grapes.

name: Fontaine de Jouvence
instructions: Rim a martini glass with the orange slice and fleur de sel.
Combine the citrus liqueur and 6 raspberries in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vogorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the martini glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with carbonated water.
Garnish with 2 raspberries on a cocktail pick.

name: Forbidden Kiss
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the apple slices, in a shaker containing the ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into two champagne glasses using an ice strainer.
Garnish with apple slices.

name: Forever Pink
instructions: Combine raspberry liqueur and grenadine in a blender containing ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Add the irish cream liqueur.
Blend again.
Pour into two small glasses.
Garnish with a dollop of whipped cream topped with chocolate shavings.

name: French Cosmo
instructions: Combine the vodka, blackcurrant liqueur and pineapple juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a pineapple slice and a cherry.

name: French Kiss
instructions: Combine the citrus liqueur and vodka in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a flute using an ice strainer.
Add splash of grenadine.
Top up with club soda.

name: French Riviera
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) exotic fruit beverage (like Hpnotiq)
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the flower.

name: Fresh Muscat
instructions: Combine the muscat and citrus liqueur into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with tonic water.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lemon slice and lemon zest.

name: Frosted Belle
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) pear and cognac liqueur
instructions: Combine the pear and cognac liqueur and lemon juice into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with lemon wedges.

name: Frosted Maple
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) whisky and maple liqueur
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the cranberry juice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with the cranberry juice.

name: Frosty Apple
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the apple slices, in a highball glass filled with ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with apple slices.

name: Frosty Citrus
instructions: Combine the citrus liqueur and lemon-flavoured iced tea in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with lemon slices.

name: Frozen Gin & Tonic slushtail
instructions: In a saucepan, stir water and sugar together.
Heat slowly to dissolve the sugar and then remove from the flame.
Add all the other ingredients and pour into a 38×25 cm (15×10 in.) Pyrex dish.
Freeze for 1 hour and then break up the mixture with a fork, scraping down the sides.
Put everything back into the freezer and repeat these steps 4 to 5 times, breaking up the ice every 30 minutes, or until it becomes granulated.
When it’s time to serve, put the mixture into cups garnished with a pretty straw and a piece of lemon zest.

name: Frozen Margarita
instructions: Rim glass with salt.
Combine tequila, citrus liqueur, lime juice and crushed ice cubes in electric blender.
Blend on low speed, until mixture is smooth.
Pour into a margarita glass.
Garnish with slice of lime.

name: Fruit Explosion
instructions: Carefully crush the mandarin peel and wedges, cranberries and thyme sprig in a highball glass.
Add the rum.
Fill the glass with a few ice cubes.
Top up with the cranberry juice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Fruit Port-Gria
instructions: Place sage leaves in a wine glass and crush using a muddler.
Add the pink port, raspberry liqueur and white cranberry juice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add the fruit and ice cubes.
Top up with the club soda.
Garnish with the sprig of sage.

name: Fruity Aloe
instructions: Combine flavoured vodka, aloe juice and club soda in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with half-slices of lemon and a cherry.

name: Fruity Cinnamon
instructions: Place the syrup and blueberries (set a few one aside for topping) in a shaker.
Crush using a muddler.
Add the ice cubes.
Pour the vodka, cinnamon-flavoured liqueur and lemon juice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with blueberries and lemon pieces on a cocktail pick.

name: Fruity Coconut
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine the rum and coconut beverage, dry gin and citrus liqueur in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add the cranberry juice.
Top up with lemonade.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a half orange slice.

name: Fruity Passion
instructions: Combine the scotch and passion fruit juice in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Add a splash of grenadine.
Garnish with a starfuit slice.

name: Fruity Safari
instructions: Pour the marula cream into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with raspberries and blueberries.

name: Fruity Sangria
ingredients: 180 mL (6 oz) Cîroc Red Berry flavoured vodka
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a large pitcher.
Gently stir.

name: Fruity Wave
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the mango slices, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the mango slices.

name: Getaway
instructions: Place one sprig of parsley in a shaker and crush using a pestle.
Add the ice cubes, tequila, citrus liqueur and lemon juice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a wine glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with ginger ale.
Garnish with the second sprig of parsley.

name: Gimlet
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass containing ice.
Mix using mixing spoon.
Strain over glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with lime wedge.
Did you know:

To encourage marines to consume Vitamin C and thus prevent scurvy, Dr. Thomas Desmond Gimlette, member of the British Navy, mixed lime juice and gin. The marines called the combination a «Gimlet» in honour of its inventor.

name: Gimlet reinvented
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker filled with ice.
Shake.
Strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with slice of lime.
A classic cocktail, reinvented by Patrice Plante from Monsieur Cocktail.

name: Gin fizz
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour in a highball glass.
Add club soda.
Garnish with lemon slices and a maraschino cherry.
Did you know:

In the days when scurvy was ravaging the British Navy, the idea dawned on Admiral Nelson to mix gin with some lemon. The result: a remedy so effective the scurvy disappeared! Upon their return to England, the sailors modified the recipe by adding sugar and carbonated water, making the drink more refreshing and pleasant tasting.

name: Gin Grapefruit
instructions: Combine dry gin and grapefruit juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with grapefruit wedge.

name: Gin tonic
instructions: Pour dry gin into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with tonic water.
Garnish with slices of lime.
Did you know:

This cocktail dates back to 1750, when British naval officers added quinine to gin to treat fever. So popular was this «medicine» that it caused a rise in alcoholism in England. However, it was not until establishments dedicated purely to gin consumption opened the mid 1800s that the Gin Tonic became a respectable beverage.

name: Gin Tonic with grapes
instructions: Pour the dry gin in a wine glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with tonic water.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add a few grapes.
Garnish with 3 grapes on a cocktail pick.

name: Gin-gin
instructions: Combine the dry gin, aloes juice and ginger beer in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with tonic water.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with lemon slices.

name: Ginger Brandy
instructions: Combine the brandy, ginger ale and lemonade in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange wedges.

name: Ginger Cognac
instructions: Combine the cognac, lime juice and cane syrup in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with ginger ale.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Gently rub the mint leaves between your palms to bring out the flavours.
Garnish with the mint leaves and ginger slices.

name: Ginger Fizz
instructions: Combine the ginger and sugar in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Crush using a muddler.
Add the rum, crème de cassis and ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with lemonade.
Garnish with lime slices.

name: Ginger Mulito
instructions: Combine the syrup, mint leaves and lemon cubes in a highball glass.
Crush using a pestle.
Add the ice cubes and vodka.
Top up with ginger ale.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a lemon slice.

name: Ginger Rum
instructions: Pour the spiced rum in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with ginger ale.
Add the fresh lime juice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish according to your inspiration.

name: Ginger Scotch
instructions: Pour the scotch into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with the ginger ale.
Garnish with the lime wedge.

name: Ginger Vodka
instructions: Combine the vodka and ginger ale in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 secondes.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime wedge.

name: Ginger-mint delight
instructions: Gently grind mint in highball glass.
Fill glass with ice.
Add dry gin and fill with ginger ale.
Stir gently.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint.

name: Gingerbread
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.

name: Gingerbread
ingredients: 500 mL (2 cups) store-bought sweetened iced tea
5 mL (1 tsp) freshly ground nutmeg (plus extra, for garnish)
instructions: In a pitcher filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, iced tea, lemon juice and spices. Stir well. Add the ginger ale, and immediately divide among 6 glasses. Garnish each glass with a slice of pineapple and a few cranberries. Sprinkle with freshly ground nutmeg.

name: Glam
instructions: Combine the white rum and lime juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Add caster sugar and a few lime wedges.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a flute glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Glamour
instructions: Combine the whiskey and dessert wine in a tulip glass containing the ice cube.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange twist.
Pro tip:
In addition to adding a hint of sweetness to cocktails, dessert wines go beautifully with fruit or nut pastries. Either way, every sip is a treat.

name: Go Habs Go
ingredients: 8 ml (1/4 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Combine pear juice and citrus liqueur in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a shooter using an ice strainer.
Add the grenadine syrup into the shooter. Allow it to settle at the bottom of the glass.
Combine vodka and citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao) in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously.

name: Godfather
instructions: Combine whiskey and almond liqueur in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a cocktail pick.
Did you know:

The well-known Godfather cocktail was created by a champion mixologist! In fact, it was invented by Donato «Duke» Antone, who has twice been crowned World Champion Mixologist and is now the director of the Bartending School of Mixology. Antone is also the mastermind behind the Rusty Nail.

name: Gold & Ginger
instructions: Pour rum into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with ginger ale.
Squeeze lime wedges over glass and use them as garnish.

name: Golden Apple
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) white or amber rum
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the apple slices and cinnamon stick, in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the 2 apple slices and cinnamon stick.

name: Golden Caesar
instructions: Squeeze the juice from the celery pieces using a citrus juicer or garlic press.
Pour the celery juice into a highball glass containing the ice cubes.
Add the vodka, passion-fruit juice, spicy sauce and salt.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Slowly pour in the strawberry liqueur to create a layered cocktail.
Garnish with the celery stick.

name: Golden Gate Cosmo
instructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Golden Peach
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the peach slices, in a highball glass filled with ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with peach slices.

name: Golden Shiver
instructions: Combine the cinnamon liqueur, Irish cream liqueur and chilled coffee in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the whipped cream, and chocolate shavings.

name: Golden Star
instructions: Pour the anise liqueur into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with the ginger ale.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the star anise.

name: Grand Prix
ingredients: 25 ml (3/4 oz) bitter citrus liqueur (like Campari)
instructions: Combine the vodka, lemon juice and ginger ale in a beer flute containing a few ice cubes.
Slowly pour in the bitter citrus liqueur to make a layered cocktail.
Garnish with the orange slice.

name: Grandbois
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) whisky and maple liqueur
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the orange slice, in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange slice.

name: Grape Lily
instructions: Combine the almond liqueur, grape juice and lemon juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the grapes on a cocktail pick.

name: Grapefruit Margarita
instructions: Frost the rim of a margarita glass using water and salt.
Combine all the ingredients, except for the grapefruit wedge, in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a margarita glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.

name: Grapefruit Vodka
instructions: Rim a highball glass with lemon juice and salt.
Pour the vodka and grapefruit juice into a glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with the half-slices of grapefruit.

name: Grapester
ingredients: 10 ml (1/3 oz.) elderflower cordial or liqueur
instructions: In a shaker, crush 5 grapes with sugar using a muddler.
Add lime juice, ginger syrup, elderflower cordial, dry gin and ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with white grape and twist of lime.

name: Grappirinha
instructions: Combine the lime pieces and sugar in an old-fashioned glass.
Using a pestle, crush the lime to extract the juice and dissolve the sugar.
Pour in the grappa.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add the crushed ice.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Grasshopper
instructions: Combine green Crème de Menthe, Crème de Cacao and 35% cream in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into martini glass using ice strainer.
Sprinkle with chocolate powder.
Garnish with mint leaves.

name: Green Christmas
instructions: Pour the rum, mint leaves and lime twist into an highball glass.
Coarsely crush with a spoon or pestle.
Add the ice cubes, lemon juice and soda.
Slowly pour in the melon liqueur to form a layered drink.
Garnish with a mint leaf.

name: Green Tea Cosmo
instructions: Combine all ingredients in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a margarita glass using an ice strainer.

name: Grinch
instructions: Combine the dry gin and melon liqueur in a shaker ?lled with ice cubes.
Add the ginger.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with ginger ale.
Garnish with a slice of honeydew melon.

name: Habana Breeze
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) cherry liqueur (like cherry brandy)
instructions: Pour the rum, honey and lime juice into an old-fashioned glass.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Add a few ice cubes.
Top up with tonic water.
Slowly pour in the cherry liqueur.
Garnish with the lime zest.

name: Hakuna Banana
instructions: Pour the banana liqueur and maraschino-cherry syrup in a highball glass containing one ice cube.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Put aside.
Pour the marula cream and water in a shaker containing a few ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain slowly into a highball glass using an ice strainer

name: Half-and-half
instructions: Pour the golden and red aperitif wines into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange slice.

name: Happy Camper
ingredients: 45 mL (1 1/2 oz) Chic Choc spiced rum
instructions: Fill a 500-mL (2-cup) Mason jar with ice cubes.
Pour in the rum and coffee.
Add the drops of lemon extract and stir.
Rub the rim with the lemon slice and add the ginger ale.
Garnish with the slice of lemon.

name: Harvest gin fizz
ingredients: 1 splash of green mint syrup or green crème de menthe
instructions: Combine the gin and mint syrup in a highball glass containing the ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Top up with apple must.
Garnish with apple slices and mint leaves

name: Hawaiian cosmo
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the apple and pineapple slices, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with an apple slice and a pineapple slice.

name: Hazelnut Coffee
instructions: In a bowl, combine 30 ml (1 oz) of the hazelnut liqueur, the maple syrup and the whipping cream.
Whip to firm peaks.
Refrigerate.
Frost the rims of four toddy glass with the maple sugar.
Pour 15 ml (1/2 oz) of the hazelnut liqueur into each cup, and fill with coffee.
Garnish with the flavoured whipped cream.
Serves 4

name: Hazelnut Delight
instructions: Combine the hazelnut liqueur, irish cream liqueur and milk in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Sprinkle with nutmeg.

name: Heat of Africa
instructions: Pour marula fruit liqueur and rum into a shooter glass.
Garnish with whipped cream.
Sprinkle with cocoa powder.

name: Heat Seeker
ingredients: 15 mL (1/2 oz) brine from a jar of banana peppers
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the banana peppers, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini using an ice strainer.
Garnish with banana pepper slices.

name: Herbaceous Mojito
instructions: Pour the sugar cane syrup in an old-fashioned glass containing the lime wedges.
Crush using a pestle.
Add the ice cubes and herb liqueur.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint.

name: Holiday Bubbles
instructions: Soaked sugar cubes: Pour some blackcurrant liqueur in a bowl. Dip sugar cubes until they become completely pink. You can prepare these in advance; they’ll become easier to handle.
Place a sugar cube in a flute.
Pour almond liqueur.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Grate lemon and orange above flute.

name: Holiday Mojito
instructions: Squeeze the half lime into a highball glass and place in the glass.
Add the mint leaves and 5 raspberries, and crush using a muddler.
Add the sugar, ice cubes and rum.
Top up with the club soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with 3 lime quarters, a raspberry and a sprig of mint.

name: Holiday Mojito, punch version
instructions: Squeeze the 4 limes into a punch bowl.
Add the mint leaves and 15 raspberries, and crush using a muddler.
Add the sugar, ice cubes and rum.
Top up with the club soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Serve in highball glasses filled with ice cubes.
Garnish with lime quarters, raspberries and mint sprigs.

name: Holiday Punch
instructions: Combine all ingredients except sparkling wine in a punch bowl.
Refrigerate for 2 hours.
Add the chilled sparkling wine immediately before serving.
Garnish glasses with slices of pineapple.

name: Holiday-cheer coffee
instructions: In a saucepan, heat the milk and the spices.
Add the maple cream and stir.
Add one cup of hot espresso coffee to each glass or mug. Then divide the heated milk mixture among the glasses.
Top each glass with whipped cream.
4 servings

name: Homme Moderne
instructions: Place the sugar cube in an old-fashioned glass.
Drizzle the sugar cube with Angostura bitters and half the scotch.
Crush and stir until the sugar is completely dissolved.
Add the remaining scotch.
Add ice cubes.
Garnish with orange zest.

name: Honey Deuce
instructions: Pour the vodka and raspberry liqueur into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with lemonade.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the 3 frozen balls of honeydew on a skewer.

name: Honey Lemonade
instructions: Combine the honey liqueur and lemonade in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a cherry.

name: Honey Mango
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) freshly squeezed lime juice
instructions: Combine the honey liqueur, lime juice and mango juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass filled with ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Honey punch
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a punch bowl.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses containing a few ice cubes and some orange slices from the bowl.

name: Honey Square
instructions: Combine honey liqueur, spiced rum, sour mix and apple juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lime zest.

name: Horizon
instructions: Combine the lemon liqueur and orange juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Add the grenadine syrup.
Garnish with a half orange slice.

name: Hot Cider
instructions: Pour the hot apple cider into a toddy glass.
Add the almond liqueur and amber rum.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

name: Hot toddy gin
ingredients: 1 ml (1/4 tsp.) whole cloves, or a pinch of nutmeg
instructions: Pour the dry gin, lemon juice and honey into a cup or hot "toddy" glass.
Add the cloves or pinch of nutmeg.
Fill the cup with boiling water.
Let infuse for several minutes.
Savour.

name: Hot war
instructions: Combine the vodka and irish cream in a toddy glass.
Top up with hot chocolate milk.
Float the cream on top and sprinkle with nutmeg.

name: Hpnosia
instructions: Pour the fruit beverage and sparkling wine into a flute.

name: Hunter-Gatherer
ingredients: 120 ml (4 oz.) cherry cola (like Dr. Pepper)
instructions: Combine herb liqueur and cherry cola in a rock glass or old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes.
Garnish with a lemon wedge and a maraschino cherry.

name: Hurricane
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in the blender except the grenadine syrup, orange wedge and maraschino cherry.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a tulip glass.
Top it off with some grenadine syrup.
Garnish with the orange wedge and maraschino cherry on a pick.
Did you know:

The Hurricane was created by Pat O'Brien, owner of a New Orleans speakeasy highly frequented by sailors. During the Second World War, he noticed he had a constant surplus of rum, so he decided to create a cocktail featuring three types of rum and served it in a glass he called a «Hurricane glass.»

name: Ice blue slushtail
ingredients: 220 ml (7 1/2 oz.) citrus liqueur (blue Curaçao type)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the tonic water, lime juice, citrus liqueur and gin.
Mix together.
Pour this mixture into a 38 x 25 cm (15 x 10 in.) Pyrex dish.
Freeze for 1 hour and then break up the mixture with a fork, scraping down the sides.
Put everything back into the freezer and repeat these steps 3 to 5 times, breaking up the ice every 30 minutes, or until it becomes granulated.
When it’s time to serve, put the mixture into cups (you’ll have about 4 servings).
Garnish with a straw and an orange slice.

name: Ice Cream Float
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the orange slice and zest, in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a half orange slice and zest.

name: Ice Fairy
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker, except for the tonic water and maraschino cherries.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into two old-fashioned glasses using an ice strainer.
Top up with the tonic water.
Garnish each drink with a maraschino cherry.

name: Iced Apple Martini
instructions: Combine vodka and ice cider in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.

name: Iced Cappuccino
ingredients: Cocoa powder or a coffee bean (optional)
instructions: Combine the cappuccino cream liqueur, coffee liqueur, milk and ice cubes in the blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a highball glass.
Garnish with the whipped cream, cocoa powder and/or coffee bean.

name: Iced chocolate martini
ingredients: 180 mL (6 oz) cherry juice (or fruit-and-cherry-juice blend)
instructions: In a shaker, combine all the ingredients (except the cherries) and shake vigorously.
Divide among 4 chilled martini glasses.
Garnish each glass with a maraschino cherry and some whipped cream, if desired.

name: Iced Coco
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the cherry, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a cherry.

name: Iced honey tea
instructions: Combine all the ingredients into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.

name: Iced Lemon
instructions: Combine the vodka, lemonade and 3 basil leaves in a blender containing ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a margarita glass.
Top up with tonic water.
Garnish with a lemon slice and a basil leaf on a cocktail pick.

name: Icy Peach
instructions: Pour the peach liqueur in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with iced tea.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the peach slices.

name: Imperial Martini
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except the candied ginger, in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with candied ginger.

name: Incandescent Punch
ingredients: 2 cups (16 oz.) grenadine syrup (or other berry syrup)
instructions: Pour all ingredients except the club soda and fruit into a punch bowl.
Stir, cover and leave to infuse in the refrigerator for 24 hours, stirring occasionally.
Add the club soda and the fruit.

name: Inspire
instructions: Combine bitter liqueur and vermouth in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes. Top up with sparkling wine. Garnish with orange slice.

name: Irish Almond
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Combine the Irish cream liqueur, citrus liqueur and milk in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a cognac glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a star anise.

name: Irish coffee
instructions: Pour hot espresso into a toddy glass and add sugar.
Pour in Irish whiskey.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Top with whipped cream.
Pro tip:
Instead of topping it with whipped cream, pour a layer fresh cream over the back of a spoon onto the spiked coffee. Do not stir.
Did you know...
