During Word War II, after a tiring 18-hour flight in bad weather, some American travellers arrived in Ireland by seaplane. The perceptive restaurant manager on duty concluded that these foreign guests might appreciate something a little stronger than coffee or tea. At his suggestion, the head chef put together a concoction now known as Irish Coffee.

name: Irish Cup
instructions: Pour whiskey and Angostura bitters into a Collins or highball glass.
Squeeze orange wedges into this mixture.
Add ice cubes.
Top up with cola and club soda.

name: Irish Express
instructions: Combine the coffee, irish cream liqueur and cognac in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into a highball glass.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and pepper.

name: Irish Lemonade
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the soda and Angostura, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Top with club soda.
Add a dash of Angostura without stirring.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

name: Irresistibly Cuban
instructions: Combine the rum and apricot liqueur in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add the maple syrup, lemon juice and apple juice.
Top up with the club soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the 3 slices of red apple.

name: Island beauty
ingredients: 40 ml (1 1/4 oz.) pear and cognac liqueur
instructions: In a highball glass, pour half of the pear and cognac liqueur.
Using a muddler, crush the lime slices and fresh mint leaves in the glass.
Add ice cubes and dilute with club soda.
Top with the other half of the pear and cognac liqueur.
Garnish with mint leaves and a slice of lime.

name: Island Treasure
instructions: Place the cherries and lime quarters in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add the rum.
Top up with club soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Italian chocolate martini
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) grappa-based chocolate cream (like Gianduia)
instructions: Combine the grappa-based chocolate hazelnut liqueur and vodka in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the chocolate shavings.

name: Italian Kir
instructions: Pour the blackcurrant liqueur into a flute.
Top up with the sparkling wine.

name: Italian Kiss
instructions: Pour the almond liqueur and pomegranate juice into a flute glass.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish with the orange zest.

name: Italissimo
instructions: Combine bitter liqueur, grapefruit juice and carbonated water in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Decorate with 1/2 slice of grapefruit.

name: Italotonic
instructions: Pour the red vermouth into a highball glass filled with ice cubes.
Top up with the tonic water.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lemon slice.

name: Jack Rose
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.

name: Jack’O’Lantern
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the coffee beans, in a balloon glass (or brandy snifter) filled with ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Place the coffee beans in the glass as to create the face of a Jack'O'Lantern.

name: Jäger Ginger
instructions: Pour the herb liqueur in a highball glass half-filled with ice cubes. Squeeze the lime wedge over the glass. Top up with ginger ale. Stir using a mixing spoon. Garnish with the cucumber slices. Serve with a stirrer or cocktail stick.

name: Jazz
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) peach and bourbon liqueur (like Southern Comfort)
instructions: Combine the peach and bourbon liqueur, vodka and orange juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with an orange zest.

name: Jelly Bean
instructions: Place the raspberries and the ginger in a shaker.
Crush using a pestle.
Add all the other ingredients.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.

name: Jinx
instructions: Combine the dry gin, vodka and pineapple juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add pepper.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Gently pour the grenadine syrup over the back of a spoon to create a layered cocktail.
Garnish with a pineapple slice and a raspberry on a cocktail pick.

name: Joli coeur
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with fresh green grapes on a pick.

name: Kamikaze
instructions: Combine the vodka, citrus liqueur and lime juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes, using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime wedge.
Did you know:
The story has it that this cocktail was invented in Japan's Yokosuka naval base (near Tokyo) when the country was under American occupation. In Japanese, kamikaze means «divine wind.»

name: Karamello
ingredients: 45 ml (1 ½ oz.) rum cream liqueur
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with caramel shavings.

name: Katy Berry
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker, except 1 strawberry and 1 mint leaf.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes, using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a strawberry and mint leaf.

name: Key Lime Cream Pie
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the lime slice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime slice.

name: Kiwi Crazy
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender, except for the kiwi slice and one basil leaf.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a margarita glass.
Garnish with a kiwi slice and a basil leaf on a cocktail pick.

name: Klover Leaf
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker, except the mint and a few crushed ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Mash the crushed ice and a few mint leaves in a highball glass, using a pestle.
Strain into the highball glass containing the mashed ice mixture, using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a mint leaf.

name: La québécoise
instructions: Pour the caramel sauce along the rim and inside of a margarita glass.
Let stand in the freezer until the caramel has hardened.
Moisten the rim of the glass with the lemon juice.
Frost the rim of the glass with the granulated maple sugar.
Pour in the coffee liqueur, ice cider and apple juice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Lady Apple
instructions: Combine vodka, apple brandy, apple juice and ground cinnamon in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a flute using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a thin slice of apple and cinnamon stick.

name: Lagoon
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
15 ml (1/2 oz.) raspberry liqueur (like Sour Puss)
instructions: Combine the vodka, citrus liqueur and strawberry liqueur in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Add the lemon juice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with strawberries and blueberries on a cocktail pick.

name: Late Hour
instructions: Combine hazelnut liqueur, tequila and peach juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with peach slice and lime zest.

name: Latin Quarter
instructions: Combine the peppercorns and 3 tarragon leaves in a shaker and crush using a muddler.
Add the gin, juice and citrus liqueur.
Add the ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a wine glass using an ice strainer.
Squeeze the grapefruit zest over the cocktail for flavouring.
Garnish with the grapefruit wedge.

name: Le Bandit
ingredients: Quarter of fresh pineapple, cut into pieces
Quarter of pineapple for the garnishing
instructions: Combine the spiced rum, almond liqueur and pineapple juice in a shaker.
Add the ice cubes and set aside.
Place the pieces of pineapple and the fresh mint in a high edged container.
Using a hand held blender, mix together until liquid.
Pour into the shaker and add half of the sugar.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds or until even.
Frost the rim of an old-fashioned glass with sugar.
Strain into the old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Garnish with a piece of pineapple.

name: Le Bandit, punch version
instructions: Place the pieces of frozen pineapple in a punch bowl and pour the spiced rum, the almond liqueur and the pineapple juice.
Add the ginger ale.
Pour into old-fashioned glasses.
Garnish each glass with a bunch of mint.

name: Le Spritz d'ici
instructions: Combine all the ingredient, except for the orange slices, in a wine glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with orange slices.

name: Lemon Amaretto
instructions: Combine the almond liqueur and lemon juice in an old-fashioned glass containing crushed ice cubes.
Garnish with the lemon slices.

name: Lemon Coffee
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lime slices.

name: Lemon Coffee, punch version
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a punch bowl (except for the lime slices).
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses.
Garnish with the lime slices.
Serves 14 to 15

name: Lemon Drop
instructions: Pour the citrus-flavoured rum into a shooter glass.
Bite into the lemon and then drink the shooter in one gulp

name: Lemon gin
instructions: Combine the dry gin, boiling water and lemon juice in a toddy glass.
Add the sugar.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lemon wedge and 2 cinnamon sticks.

name: Lemon love
instructions: Using the lemon wedge, moisten the rim of the martini glass, then dip rim in sugar.
Pour all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using ice strainer.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

name: Lemon Pie
instructions: Rim the martini glass with the lemon wedge and dip into the graham crackers. Set aside.
Combine all the ingredients, except for the lemon twist, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lemon twist.

name: Lemon Rosso
instructions: Combine the almond liqueur, red vermouth, pomegranate juice and lemon juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lemon slices.

name: Lemonade love
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.

name: Lemonade Shiver
instructions: Combine the dry gin, lemonade and orange juice in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with an orange wedge.

name: Lemony Anise
instructions: Pour the anise liqueur in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with lemonade.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lemon slices.

name: Lemony Mint
instructions: Combine the mint leaves (except for one leaf) and lemon-flavoured vodka in a highball glass and crush using a muddler.
Add the vodka, lime juice, syrup and ice cubes.
Top up with lemon-lime soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add the grenadine.
Garnish with a mint leaf and a pomegrenate slice.

name: Lemony Sunshine
ingredients: 25 ml (3/4 oz.) sweet and sour mix
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the mint, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a sprig of mint.

name: Licorice Fizz
instructions: Combine the anise liqueur, soda and lemon juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with the 2 lemon wedges.

name: Light sweater
ingredients: 500 mL (2 cups) Earl Grey tea, hot
instructions: In a teapot or a heat-resistant pitcher, combine the rum, almond liqueur, hot tea and lemon juice.
Stir gently.
Divide among 4 mugs and garnish with the lemon and orange zests.

name: Lime Night
instructions: Combine the white rum, lemon liqueur and lime juice in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a champagne flute using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime slices.

name: Lime Punch
ingredients: 1 can of frozen concentrated lime juice
Half a honeydew melon cut in small balls (or watermelon)
instructions: Dissolve the honey in dry gin mixed with the triple sec, in a large punch bowl or pitcher.
Add one can of frozen concentrated lime juice and mash it with a fork into a slushie consistency.
Add a generous quantity of ice cubes.
Add small melon balls formed from half honeydew, plus the tonic water.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with more melon balls and some lime slices before serving.

name: Lingot
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with an orange slice.

name: Litchi Delight, punch version
ingredients: 210 ml (7 oz.) cranberry and pomegranate juice
instructions: Fill a pitcher half full with ice cubes.
Add the fruit.
Mix all the ingredients except for the granulated sugar.
Frost the rim of five margarita glasses with granulated sugar.
Pour into the margarita glasses.
Garnish each glass with a star fruit slice and lychee.

name: Litchi Rose
instructions: Combine the vodka, juices and cream in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the strawberry.

name: London Lemonade
instructions: Pour the dry gin, lychee liqueur and lemonade in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Add the frozen blueberries.

name: Long island iced tea
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour cola over ice cubes in a highball glass.
Pour shaker contents slowly through ice strainer to form a layer over the cola.
Garnish with a slice of lemon.
Pro tip:
Give this drink a little extra consistency by adding an egg white. You can make it more refreshing by adding a little extra cola.
Did you know:

Deliciously thirst-quenching, this cocktail tastes like ice tea, even though it doesn't contain a drop of it! A Long Island bartender invented it in the 1970s after receiving recommendations from Ernest Hemingway.

name: Long Island Sour
instructions: Combine the white rum, honey liqueur, lemon juice and iced tea in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with lime slices.

name: Long island spiced tea
ingredients: 15 ml (1 oz.) (each) water, sugar, fresh lemon and lime juice
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the cola and lime wedge, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes, using an ice strainer.
Top up with cola.
Garnish with the lime wedge.

name: Love Bubbles
instructions: Place the strawberry purée and mint leaves in a shaker.
Add the ginger syrup.
Crush using a muddler.
Pour in the vodka.
Add the ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a flute using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Top up with rosé champagne.
Garnish with the strawberry.

name: Lychee 2.0
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except the 2 lychee, in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with 2 lychee.

name: Lychee Love
instructions: Combine all ingredients except for the lemon twist and lychee in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a chilled martini glass using an ice strainer and sieve.
Garnish with a lemon twist and a lychee.

name: Lychee Tonic
instructions: Combine the lychee liqueur and grenadine syrup in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with tonic water.
Garnish with strawberry slices.

name: Madonna
instructions: Combine the dry gin, almond liqueur, cranberry juice and cola in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange and lime wedges, as well as the maraschino cherry.

name: Madonna, punch version
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a punch bowl.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Serve in highball glasses.

name: Madrid Fizz
instructions: In a shaker, combine gin, lemon juice, elderberry syrup, egg white, and ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a champagne glass using an ice strainer.
Add sparkling wine.
Garnish with a few drops of angostura bitters.

name: Magic Potion
instructions: Combine maple syrup cream liqueur and milk, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 15 to 20 seconds. A rich head of froth should form.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.
Combine rum and carrot juice, in the shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain gently into the glass.
Pro tip:
If you prefer, you can use Irish cream instead of maple cream.

name: Mai Tai
instructions: Combine crushed ice and ingredients except lime and mint in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into an old-fashioned glass.
Garnish with lime wedge.
Add sprig of mint.
Did you know:

The Mai Tai was invented in 1944 by Victor J. «Trader Vic» Bergeron, in his tiki restaurant in California. Using Jamaican rum as his base, he combined it with lime and added a subtle hint of almond. Upon tasting this new drink, two of his friends exclaimed «mai tai,» a Tahitian expression meaning «the best of them all.»

name: Mandarin
instructions: Combine the vodka, citrus liqueur and apple juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with an apple slice, a half orange slice and an orange zest.

name: Mandrin Capirovska
instructions: Combine the orange cubes and syrup in an old-fashioned glass.
Crush using a muddler.
Add the ice cubes and vodka.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with an orange zest.

name: Mango Burst
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) mango juice from concentrate
instructions: Combine mango juice, apple juice, soda and ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass containing ice.
Stir with mixing spoon.
Garnish with slice of lime.

name: Mango Martini
instructions: Frost the rim of a martini glass using lemon juice and sugar.
Combine the vodka, citrus liqueur and mango juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the martini glass using an ice strainer.
Carefully pour grenadine syrup down the side of the glass so it settles at the bottom.

name: Manguilic
ingredients: 60 ml (1/4 cup) frozen mango, in pieces
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a blender, except for the orange zest.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a martini glass.
Garnish with the piece of orange zest.

name: Manhattan
instructions: Combine whisky, red vermouth, and Angostura bitters into a mixing glass containing the ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon for 8 to 10 seconds.
Filter over a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
Did you know:

This cocktail was first made in 1874 at the Manhattan Club in New York. It was concocted to mark a party celebrating the election of Governor William J. Tilden. The bartender (whose name has since been lost) who invented this drink decided to name it after the club where he worked. Fun fact: the host of the evening was Winston Churchill's mother.

name: Maple Goodness
instructions: Frost the rim of a highball glass with maple sugar.Place a few ice cubes in glass.
Add remaining ingredients except cinnamon stick.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

name: Maple Goodness, punch version
instructions: Combine all ingredients except maple sugar in a pitcher.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Frost the rims of 8 highball glasses with maple sugar.
Pour the beverage into the glasses and serve.

name: Maple iced coffee
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the mint leaf, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the mint leaf.

name: Maple Martini
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) maple liqueur (like Grand Esprit)
instructions: Combine all ingredients except cocoa powder in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain over a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with cocoa powder.

name: Maple Mojito
instructions: Place mint leaves, maple syrup, and lime juice in a highball glass.
Crush well using a muddler.
Add the ice cubes, the rum, then the club soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with mint leaves and a slice of lime.

name: Maple Mojito, punch version
instructions: Combine lime juice, maple syrup and about 30 mint leaves in a large punch bowl.
Crush using a muddler.
Add rum and the club soda.
Serve in tall glasses filled with ice cubes.
Garnish with mint leaves and slices of lime.

name: Maple Water
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz) whisky and maple syrup liqueur
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the candy, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass that has been chilled in the freezer using an ice strainer.
Add a few ice cubes.
Garnish with the candy.

name: Maple whisky sour
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice cubes, add all ingredients except the orange wedge and the cherry.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour the contents of the shaker into an old-fashioned glass.
Add the maraschino cherry to the glass.
Decorate with the orange wedge.

name: Mapple Smash
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) Whisky and maple liqueur
instructions: Place blueberries in a shaker and crush using a pestle.
Add all ingredients, except for the maple sugar, lemon zests and crushed ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing crushed ice using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Garnish with blueberry pulp, maple sugar and lemon zests.

name: Margarita
instructions: Rim a margarita glass with fine salt.
Pour the tequila and citrus liqueur into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Add the lime juice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the margarita glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime wedge.
Pro tip:
For a perfectly slushy consistency, make this drink in the electric blender with a lot of ice.
Did you know:

The Margarita was invented in 1948 by Margarita Sames of Mexico. When entertaining guests from all over the globe, she served a mixture of tequila, lime juice and Cointreau. These guests were delighted by the cocktail and honoured their host by naming the drink after her.

name: Margarita Blanco
instructions: Rim glass with sugar.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake well and pour into a margarita glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with one or two orange sections.

name: Margarita Italiana
instructions: Rim a martini glass with sugar.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, except the lemon zest.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass, using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lemon zest.

name: Margarita Rosita
instructions: Rim a margarita glass with sugar.
Combine all the ingredients, except the strawberry, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the strawberry.

name: Margatini
instructions: Combine all liquid ingredients in a blender containing a few ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a margarita glass.
Garnish according to your inspiration.

name: Mariana milkshake
instructions: Put all ingredients (can be done in a shaker).
Mix until you get a homogeneous texture.
Pour into a glass and garnish with chocolate shavings.

name: Marseille Ti’ Punch
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the fruits, in a mixing glass filled with ice cubes. Stir vigorously using a mixing spoon. Strain into an old fashioned-glass filled with ice cubes using an ice strainer. Garnish with an orange and a pineapple slice.
Pro tip:
* Orgeat syrup is available in better grocery stores, or can be replaced by 8 ml simple syrup mixed with 2 drops of almond extract.

name: Martini Chocolaté
instructions: Combine the vodka and crème de cacao in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with chocolate shavings and the maraschino cherry.

name: Martini Lychee
instructions: Combine the vodka, lychee liqueur and lychee juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Squeeze lime and add to the shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lychee fruit on a cocktail pick.

name: Martini Moonlight
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the orange zest and blackberry, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker is frosted with condensation.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the orange zest and blackberry on a pick.

name: Marula Shake
instructions: Combine the first five ingredients in a blender containing ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into two martini glasses.
Add a scoop of ice cream in each drink.
Garnish each drink with a peach slice.

name: Marula-Coco
instructions: Combine the marula cream and coconut water in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a coconut slice.

name: Melon and Coconut
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) rum and coconut beverage (like Malibu)
instructions: Combine the rum and coconut beverage and melon liqueur in a highball glass containing the crushed ice cubes.
Top up with pineapple juice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lemon and watermelon slices.

name: Melon Ball
instructions: Combine all ingredients in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish according to your inspiration.

name: Melon Daiquiri
instructions: Place the honeydew melon cubes in a shaker and crush using a pestle.
Add all other ingredients, except the honeydew slice.
Add the ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a honeydew slice.

name: Melon Gin
instructions: Combine the dry gin and melon liqueur in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Add the ginger.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with ginger ale.
Garnish with a slice of honeydew melon.

name: Melon Lagoon
instructions: Combine the melon liqueur and vodka in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with lime zest and cantaloupe balls.

name: Melon Margarita
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender until smooth and very thick (mixture will loosen immediately once poured).
Divide into highball glasses.
Garnish with watermelon wedges and jalapeño slices .

name: Melon Medley
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the frozen melon, in a Collins or highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a frozen melon mini-brochette.

name: Melon Paradise
instructions: Pour the melon liqueur in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes. Slowly pour in the pineapple juice to form a layered cocktail. Garnish with a pineapple leaf and slice.

name: Melontini
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the watermelon slice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Garnish with the watermelon slice.

name: Metropolis
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the grapefruit zest, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a chilled martini glass using an ice strainer and sieve.
Garnish with grapefruit zest.

name: Mexican Mule
instructions: Combine the tequila, lime juice and syrup in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with ginger ale.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with lime slices.

name: Mezzo-Mezzo
instructions: Combine the red and dry vermouth in an old-fashioned glass filled with ice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange wedge.

name: Miami Sunrise
instructions: Combine vodka, citrus liqueur and orange juice into a balloon glass.
Slowly pour in cranberry juice to create a layered cocktail.
Garnish with an orange slice and a maraschino cherry.

name: Midnight bubbles
ingredients: A splash of citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Combine the vodka, citrus liqueur and lemon juice into a champagne flute.
Top up with the sparkling wine.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Place a lemon zest in the flute.

name: Midnight Coffee
instructions: Pour coffee into a toddy glass.
Add Irish cream liqueur and flavoured vodka.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Top with whipped cream, if desired.
Enjoy your Festive cocktail.

name: Midnight Garden
instructions: Place the coriander and one lime slice in an old-fashioned glass and crush using a muddler.
Add all other ingredients.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Milan Coffee
instructions: Combine anise liqueur with hot coffee in a toddy glass.
Garnish with whipped cream and a star anise.

name: Milky Way
instructions: Whisk eggs and sugar until pale in colour and thick in a large bowl. Set aside.

Bring cream and milk to a slight boil in a saucepan.
Stirring with a spatula, add Irish cream liqueur, cinnamon, ginger, and orange zest.
Pour hot milk over egg mixture, still whisking.
Let cool for about 30 minutes.
Strain using a sieve and refrigerate for 4 hours.
Serve plain, on ice, or garnished with whipped cream and ground cinnamon.

name: Millionnaire
instructions: Combine vodka, citrus liqueur, egg white and grenadine in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with soda.
Garnish with maraschino cherry.
Pro tip:
For best results, beat egg white for a few seconds before pouring it into the shaker.

name: Mimosa
instructions: Pour the sparkling wine and orange juice into a flute glass.
Stir with a mixing spoon.

name: Minaki
instructions: Combine all ingredients except the blueberries in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the blueberries.

name: Minitini
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) juice from a jar of olives
instructions: In a shaker, shake up the vermouth, gin and olive juice with ice.
Pour into your glasses.
Fill with beer.
Garnish each glass with two olives and one slice of lemon.
Recipe from Stéphane Morin’s book Panachés. Morin teaches sommellerie on top of being a beer historian.

name: Mint julep
instructions: Place mint leaves and granulated sugar in an old-fashioned glass.
Grind mint leaves and sugar using a muddler.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Pour in the whiskey.
Stir using a mixing spoon until glass is frosty.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint.
Did you know:

A traditional drink in the Deep South, the Mint Julep is also the official cocktail of the Kentucky Derby, the famous horserace that takes place every May in Louisville, Kentucky. The mint beverage became the event's signature cocktail in 1938, when it was served in a souvenir glass for the sum of . . . 75 cents. Today, more than 100,000 Mint Juleps are downed each year during the event.

name: Minty Devil
instructions: Combine the vodka and club soda in a highball glass filled with ice cubes.
Add the green mint syrup.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Miss Litchi
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) litchi and raspberry liqueur
instructions: In a highball glass containing a few ice cubes, pour vodka and litchi-raspberry liqueur.
Add cranberry juice.
Top up with pineapple juice.
Garnish with a mint sprig.

name: Mistassini
instructions: Crush 7 blueberries in a shaker using a muddler.
Fill shaker with ice.
Pour in the dry gin, pomegranate juice and cane syrup.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the remaining blueberries and basil leaf on a pick.

name: Mister Calijo
instructions: In an old-fashioned glass, stir together all ingredients using a bar spoon.
Add a few ice cubes at a time, in order to avoid diluting the drink.
Garnish with an orange zest and a star anise.

name: Mister Ginger
instructions: Pour the Irish whiskey and the peach liqueur in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with ginger ale.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with peach slice.

name: Mix ‘n’ Melon
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the pear slices, in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with pear slices.

name: Mocha Martini
instructions: Combine ice cubes and other ingredients in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a Martini glass using an ice strainer.

name: Modern Punch
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl containing ice.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with slices of lemon.

name: Mojito
instructions: Place the mint leaves and 3 or 4 lime slices in a highball glass and crush using a muddler.
Add the sugar, white rum and ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a sprig of mint.

name: Mojito Bongo
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) sugar cane syrup (simple syrup)
instructions: Combine rum, lime juice, syrup and 3 mint leaves in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish with the remaining mint leaves on a cocktail pick.

name: Mojito del Rey
instructions: Muddle mint and lime in a highball glass. Add simple syrup and Pineau des Charentes. Fill glass with ice cubes and top up with sparkling wine.

name: Mojito Reinvented
instructions: Place the mint leaves and 2 or 3 lime quarters in a highball glass and crush using a muddler.
Add the sugar, tequila and ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lime quarter and a mint leave.

name: Mojito royale
instructions: Combine the lime juice, sugar and mint leaves in a highball glass and crush using a muddler.
Add the ice cubes, amber rum and club soda.
Top up with champagne or sparkling wine.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a mint leaf.

name: Mojitonic
instructions: Place the mint leaves and the regular syrup into a highball glass.
Crush with a pestle.
Add the other ingredients.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Enjoy your Festive cocktail.

name: Mojitonic, punch version
instructions: Combine the mint leaves and the regular syrup in a punch bowl or a pitcher.
Crush using a pestle.
Add the other ingredients.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Serve into highball glasses.
Enjoy your Festive cocktail.

name: Montréal Saint-Germain
ingredients: Splash of strawberry or raspberry syrup
instructions: Combine white rum, almond liqueur, grapefruit juice and syrup in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a Martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a slice of grapefruit.

name: Moroccan Tea
instructions: Place the mint leaves and sugar in a toddy glass and crush using a pestle.
Add the citrus liqueur and hot water.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lemon slice.

name: Morris Lemon
instructions: Combine the vodka, lemon juice and syrup into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with 2 dashes of Angostrua bitter.

name: Moscow mule
instructions: Combine vodka, lime juice, and Angostura bitters in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with ginger beer.
Stir using a mixing spoon 8 to 10 seconds.
Garnish with lime and lemon slices.
Did you know:

In 1939, most Americans were still unfamiliar with vodka. John Martin, then owner of the Smirnoff brand, had an old friend in named Jack Morgan who worked in Los Angeles trying to familiarize the American people with English ginger ale. They found the solution to their problem by combining vodka, ginger ale and lime to make the Moscow Mule. Martin would later admit: «The name didn't mean much, it was just catchy.»

name: Mulled wine
ingredients: 120 g (4 oz.) sugar (brown sugar, honey or maple syrup)
instructions: Heat the wine and sugar on medium-high heat until the sugar is completely dissolved.
When the mixture is about to come to a boil, lower the heat.*
Add the cinnamon and other spices and the liqueur.
Let the mixture infuse on low heat for 20 minutes.
Remove from heat.
Strain using a fine sieve.
Serve the drink hot in "toddy" glasses.
Decorate with an orange slice, a cinnamon stick and a star of anise.
* Although mulled wine is easy to prepare, it is important not to let the mixture boil. This will ensure the drink remains fresh-tasting and not too bitter.

name: Mumbai Mist
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) whisky and maple liqueur
instructions: Serves 2
Steep the tea for five minutes in a small saucepan containing boiling water.
Remove the tea bags.
Add the remaining liquid ingredients.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Pour into two old-fashioned glasses filled with ice cubes.
Squeeze a piece of orange peel over each drink.
Garnish with citrus slices.

name: Mystery
instructions: Place the thyme sprig in an old-fashioned glass and gently crush using a spoon.
Add the ice cubes, vermouth and dry gin.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Mystery Coffee
ingredients: 120 ml (4 oz.) maple syrup cream liqueur
Topping options: whipped cream, coffee beans, cinnamon sticks, maple sugar.
instructions: Heat the milk and maple cream liqueur in a small saucepan on low.
Prepare the coffee in a French press (like a Bodum) with boiling water or in a drip coffee maker.
Place a cardamom seed and a large, crushed orange peel in each cups.
Pour in the coffee, then the maple cream liqueur and milk mixture.
Top with whipped cream and coffee beans, a cinnamon stick, or a sprinkling of maple sugar.
Serves 4

name: Mystery Martini
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) herb liqueur (like green Chartreuse)
instructions: Combine gin, herb liqueur and cranberry juice in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a Martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with kiwi slice.

name: Negroni
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the half orange slice, in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the half orange slice.

name: Ninja
ingredients: A few drops of ginger juice (see Pro tip:)
instructions: Pour all liquid ingredients in a Mason jar containing the ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lime slice on a cocktail pick.
Pro tip:
Simply crush a piece of fresh ginger in a garlic press to extract the juice.

name: Nordic old fashioned
instructions: In a glass filled with ice, gently stir all ingredients together for 10 seconds using a spoon.
Chef Arnaud Marchand, restaurant Chez Boulay

name: North Star
ingredients: 15 mL (1/2 oz) whisky maple liqueur (Sortilège or other)
instructions: Pour the brandy, liqueur and apple juice into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the apple slice sticked with one or several cloves.

name: Northern rose
instructions: In a saucepan, heat the water with the sugar, tea bags and half the raspberries, until the sugar dissolves and the raspberries resemble compote (about 5 minutes).
Let cool about 20 minutes and filter.
Fill 4 old-fashioned glasses with ice cubes.
Add 45 mL (1½ oz) gin to each glass.
Divide the raspberry syrup among them and top up with the soda. Garnish with fresh raspberries.

name: Nutcracker
instructions: Combine the almond liqueur, vodka and fresh cream in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Gently pour the grenadine syrup over the back of a spoon to create a layered cocktail.
Garnish according to your inspiration.

name: Odyssey
instructions: Combine the anise-flavoured spirit, lemon lime soda and lemon juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lime slice and a star anise.

name: Old fashioned maple
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in an old fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes, except the orange zest.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with an orange zest.

name: Old-fashioned
instructions: Combine the sugar cube, Angostura bitters, orange wedge and lemon zest in an old-fashioned glass, and crush with a muddler.
Add some ice cubes.
Add the whiskey.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with maraschino cherries.
Did you know:

There's no doubt that this drink is the pioneer of all cocktails. It was first made in Kentucky, at the end of the 1800s, by a man named James E. Pepper. The type of glass in which it was served also inherited the name «old-fashioned,» and it is now used for drinks served with ice.

name: One thousand and one night
instructions: Combine the vodka, lemon juice and mint leaves in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add sugar.
Top up with cooled tea.
Stir using a mixing spoon to dissolve sugar.
Garnish with a lemon slice.

name: Ono2
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) cold apricot (or peach) juice
A few drops of rose water (Available in grocery stores.)
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the sparkling wine and apricot wedge, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with the sparkling wine.
Garnish with the apricot slice.

name: Opal
instructions: Combine the rum, lime juice and spruce beer in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lime slice and berries on a cocktail pick.

name: Orange and Coffee
instructions: Combine citrus liqueur, coffee liqueur and orange juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with an orange zest.

name: Orange Blossom
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the pansy flower, in a martini glass containing 2 ice cubes.
Garnish with the pansy flower.

name: Orange Float
ingredients: 5 drops pure or artificial vanilla extract
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the ice cream and vanilla bean, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add the ice cream.
Garnish with the vanilla bean.

name: Orange Frost
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the basil leaves, in a blender containing a few ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into two old-fashioned glasses.
Gently rub the basil leaves to release their aromas.
Garnish each glass with a basil leave.

name: Orange Fusion
instructions: Combine the rum and orange juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Squeeze the lime wedge into the glass.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange wedge.

name: Orange Punch
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except the pineapple slices, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the 2 pineapple slices.

name: Orange Shiver
instructions: Combine the citrus liqueur and cranberry juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime wedge.

name: Orange Splash
instructions: Combine the dry gin and orange juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with ginger ale.
Garnish with the orange zest.

name: Orange Thunder
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice cubes, combine all ingredients, except fruit.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a hurricane or tulip glass using an ice strainer or sieve.
Garnish with slices of orange and lime and a maraschino cherry.
Add a cocktail umbrella.

name: Orange-punch madness
ingredients: 750 mL (3 cups) orange juice, freshly squeezed or store-bought
instructions: On a shallow plate, combine the salt, sugar and coriander.
Rub the rim of 6 old-fashioned glasses with the lime wedges then dip each glass rim in the salt mixture.
Fill a punch bowl with ice cubes then add the tequila, orange juice and bitters.
Add the soda.
Garnish with the orange-zest twists.

name: Orangerine
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the orange wedges, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with orange wedges.

name: Orchard Chaï
instructions: Bring water to boil.
Remove from heat.
Add tea, spices and honey.
Steep 30 minutes.
Strain liquid into toddy glass using fine strainer.
Add apple cream and apple brandy (like Calvados).
Stir with mixing spoon.
Garnish with cinnamon stick.
Serve hot or cold.

name: Oriental
instructions: Pour all the ingredients except the halved strawberry and lychee into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the halved strawberry and lychee on a pick.

name: Oriental Breeze
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the orange and starfruit slices, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the half orange and starfruit slices.

name: Othello
instructions: Combine the dry gin and apple brandy in an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes.
Gently rub the rosemary sprig between your palms to bring out its flavours.
Stir the content of the glass using the rosemary sprig.
Garnish with the rosemary sprig.

name: Ottimo
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) peach and mango juice
45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) peach and mango juice
A splash of Maraschino cherry juice
instructions: Pour the gin in a highball glass containing ice cubes.
Add all juices.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Paloma
instructions: Combine tequila, grapefruit juice and club soda in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with a wedge of pink grapefruit.

name: Paradise
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain over a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Did you know:

According to some, the Paradise has aphrodisiac powers. Drinking this mix of dry gin, apricot liqueur and orange juice apparently opens up your blood vessels and promotes better circulation. The result? Heightened sexual desire.

name: Paradise Reinvented
instructions: Combine the cranberry juice and orgeat syrup in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
If desired, garnish with a cocktail umbrella.
Pro tip:
* Orgeat syrup is available in better grocery stores, or can be replaced by 8 ml simple syrup mixed with 2 drops of almond extract.

name: Paris Chic
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime slice on a pick.

name: Parisian Cosmo
instructions: Combine all the ingredients except the orange twist into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the orange twist.

name: Parisian Trend
instructions: Combine all ingredients (except for the club soda and orange zest) in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with the orange zest (twisted around a cocktail pick).

name: Parrot
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the honeydew melon, in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a honeydew melon slice.

name: Passion Litchi
instructions: Combine the vodka, litchi liqueur and white cranberry juice into a mixing glass.
Add the lemon-lime soda.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Pour the content of the mixing glass into an old-fashioned glass.
Add the frozen raspberry and mint leaf.
Pro tip:
You can make ice cubes with red cranberry juice and you have a colourful cocktail. You can even add frozen litchi!

name: Passion Litchi, punch version
instructions: Combine the vodka, litchi liqueur and white cranberry juice into a pitcher.
Add the lemon-lime soda.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Before serving, add the frozen raspberries and mint leaves.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses filled with ice cubes.
Pro tip:
You can make ice cubes with red cranberry juice and you have a colourful cocktail. You can even add frozen litchi!

name: Passion Martini
ingredients: 90 ml (3 oz.) passion fruit and cognac beverage (like Alizé Gold)
instructions: Combine the passion fruit and cognac beverage and vodka in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lemon.

name: Passionata
instructions: Combine the white rum, vanilla liqueur, passion fruit juice and orange juice in a highball glass.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a star anise.

name: Passport to the sun
instructions: Pour dry gin into a Collins or highball glass followed by the citrus liqueur.
Slowly add the white cranberry juice.
Finish with red cranberry juice to create a layered cocktail.
Garnish with a lemon twist and a lemon wedge.

name: Patriot
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) whisky and maple liqueur (like Sortilège)
15 ml (1/2 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Combine all ingredients except for the club soda in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Top up with club soda.

name: Pause
instructions: Pour the coffee liqueur and the Americain whiskey in a margarita glass.
Combine the Irish cream and milk in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the glass using an ice strainer.

name: Peach and Orange Martini
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the lemon slice, in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lemon slice.

name: Peach and sauvignon blanc slushtail
ingredients: several peach or nectarine slices (for serving)
instructions: In a blender, combine the wine and frozen peaches.
Blend until you obtain a smooth texture.
Pour the mixture into 2 glasses* finished with a straw and 2 peach or nectarine slices.
If the texture is too liquid, put in the freezer for half an hour and break up the mixture a little with a fork.
Repeat as needed until the desired texture is reached.
* For more servings, combine 1 full bottle of wine and 1 full bag of peaches.

name: Peach and sauvignon blanc slushtail
ingredients: several peach or nectarine slices (for serving)
instructions: In a blender, combine the wine and frozen peaches and blend until you obtain a smooth texture.

Pour the mixture into cups (2 servings) with a straw and 2 peach or nectarine slices.If the texture is too liquid, put in the freezer for half an hour and break up the mixture a little with a fork. Repeat as needed until the desired texture is reached.* For more servings, combine 1 full bottle of wine and 1 full bag of peaches.

name: Peach Ice Cream Float
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the peach slice, in a blender containing ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a daiquiri glass.
Garnish with a peach slice.

name: Peach Margarita
instructions: Rim a margarita glass with sugar.
Combine all the ingredients, except for the peach slice, in an electric blender.
Blend on low until smooth.
Pour into a margarita glass.
Garnish with the peach slice on a pick.

name: Peach Margarita, punch version
instructions: Rim margarita glasses with sugar.
Combine all the ingredients (previously chilled), except for the peach slices, in an electric blender.
Blend on low until smooth.
Pour into the margarita glasses.
Garnish each glass with a peach slice on a pick.

name: Peach Pie
ingredients: 30 ml to 60 ml (1 oz. to 2 oz.) simple syrup
1 cinnamon stick or 1 ginger slice, for garnish
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the cinnamon and ginger, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick or a slice of ginger.

name: Peach rum & cola
instructions: Combine the amber rum and peach liqueur in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Top up with cola.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Peach Soda
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the peach slice, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a peach slice.

name: Peaches and Port
instructions: Crush 2 sage leaves and the halved peach in a shaker using a muddler.
Fill shaker with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a brandy snifter using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the sage leaf on a pick.

name: Peachy dream
instructions: Pour the peach liqueur in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with lemon-lime soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add the grenadine syrup.
Garnish with the peach slice.

name: Pear Margarita
instructions: Frost the rim of a margarita glass using water and salt.
Combine the tequila, citrus liqueur and pear nectar in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the margarita glass using an ice strainer.
Add the lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with a pear slice and a sprig of fresh mint.

name: Pear Martini
instructions: Combine the cane syrup and a sprig of rosemary in a shaker and crush using a muddler.
Add the vodka, pear purée, apple juice, lemon juice and ice cubes. Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary and pear wedge.

name: Pearl
instructions: Combine the vodka, anise-flavoured spirit and soda in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with strawberry quarters.

name: Pearsuasian
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the pear slice, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the pear slice.

name: Pearsuasian, punch version
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, previously chilled, in a pitcher.
Pour into highball glasses.
Garnish each glass with a pear slice.

name: Perfect Storm
ingredients: 180 ml (6 oz.) ginger ale or ginger beer
instructions: Combine the spiced rum and ginger ale in a highball glass filled with ice cubes.
Squeeze in the juice of the lime wedges.
Add the lime wedges.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Petit Marseillais
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) lemonade or grapefruit juice
instructions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass, then add a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with slice of lime and mint leaves.

name: Pina Colada
ingredients: 120 ml (4 oz.) pineapple juice (pure fruit juice)
45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) coconut cream or sweetened coconut milk
1 piece fresh pineapple cut into 1 cm thick triangle
instructions: Combine ice cubes, white rum, dark rum, coconut cream or sweetened coconut milk, and pineapple juice in an electric mixer.
Mix ingredients until smooth (maximum 10 seconds).
Pour into a tulip glass.
Garnish with pineapple piece and maraschino cherry.
Did you know:

The Piña Colada was invented on August 15, 1954, by Don Ramon Monchito Marrero, a bartender at the Hilton hotel in San Juan, Puerto Rico. His goal was to combine all the flavours of Puerto Rico in a single glass, with a particular emphasis on the fresh pineapple juice from local farms. The Piña Colada was declared that county's national beverage in 1978, and has since gained fans around the world.

name: Pina Grande
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) sugar cane syrup (plain syrup)
instructions: Combine the citrus liqueur, syrup and pineapple juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Add a sprig of rosemary.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a sprig of rosemary.

name: Piña Latte
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the lemon twists, in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into two martini glasses.
Garnish each glass with a lemon twist.

name: Piña Martini
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the pineapple slice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the pineapple slice.

name: Pina Marula
instructions: Pour the marula cream in a old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add the milk and pineapple juice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the pineapple slice and leaf.

name: Pina-Carolinaaaa
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender, except for the fruit wedges. Blend until smooth. Pour into a double old-fashioned glass. Garnish with orange and pineapple wedges.

name: Pineapple mojito
instructions: Smash pineapple slices, lime, and mint at the bottom of a shaker using a muddler.
Fill shaker with ice cubes and add all other ingredients, except pineapple leaves.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds and strain in highball glass filled with ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Decorate with pineapple leaves.

name: Pink
instructions: Place the strawberries, raspberries and blueberries in an old-fashioned glass and crush using a pestle.
Pour the white rum and raspberry-flavoured vodka.
Add a few torn mint leaves, brown sugar and ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with a few mint leaves.

name: Pink Blossom
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz) lemon liqueur (Limoncello or other)
Raspberries or small strawberries, to taste
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the fruits, in a shaker ﬁlled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with raspberries or small strawberries.
Truc de pro

Grapefruit is a great alternative to the traditional orange. To get the maximum amount of juice from one, roll a room-temperature grapefruit on the counter, pressing down firmly with your hand, before cutting it open.

name: Pink Breeze
instructions: Pour the vodka, cranberry juice and grapefruit juice in an highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the pink grapefruit wedge.

name: Pink Lady
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain over glass using an ice strainer.
Did you know:

The name, colour, ingredients and texture of the Pink Lady all point to one thing: its femininity. There's no doubt that it ranks among the finest «girly drinks.» This cocktail, which was highly popular among high society ladies in the 30s, helped make bars a more accessible place to women. In fact, it was served to help initiate them to alcohol.

name: Pink Lemonade
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the orange slice, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange slice.

name: Pinky swear
instructions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker.
Shake.
Add ice and shake again.
Strain into glass.
Garnish with lemon zest.
A cocktail created by Maximilino Vallée-Valletta, mixologist at Les Enfants Terribles.

name: Pirata
instructions: Combine all ingredients except orange zest in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a shot glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with orange zest.

name: Pisco Sour
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) cane syrup (or simple syrup)
2 to 3 drops of Angostura (concentrated bitters for cocktails)
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except the Angostura, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Add a few drops of Angostura before serving.

name: Pisco Sour Lime
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) cane syrup (or simple syrup)
A few drops of angostura bitter (concentrated bitters for cocktails)
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except the Angostura, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.
Add a few drops of Angostura to decorate.

name: Piscola
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Planter's Punch
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a highball glass.
Mix using mixing spoon.

name: Platinum Gin
instructions: Combine the dry gin, citrus liqueur and pineapple juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into a brandy snifter containing a few ice cubes, using an ice strainer.
Add a splash of ginger ale.
Garnish with the pineapple wedge.

name: Poached Pear
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the lemon zest and cinnamon, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Sprinkle with cinnamon.
Garnish with a lemon zest.

name: Podium
instructions: Combine all ingredients except for the lime wedge in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Pom Vodka
instructions: Combine the vodka and pomegranate juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the 2 lime wedges.

name: Pomegranate Martini
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lemon wedge.

name: Pomigin
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the apple slice and sprig of basil, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the apple slice and sprig of basil.

name: Pool Side Punch
ingredients: 120 ml (4 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a punch bowl.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses containing a few ice cubes and some fruit from the bowl.

name: Pool Side Punch, individual serving
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine all the ingredients except the fruit into a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the fruit.

name: Pop
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
30 ml (1 oz.) raspberry liqueur (like Sour Puss)
instructions: Combine the citrus liqueur, raspberry liqueur and lemon-lime soda in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with raspberries on a cocktail pick.

name: Praline
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the mint, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint.

name: Praline Hot Chocolate
ingredients: 1/2 cup chocolate whipped cream (prepared with cocoa or chocolate sauce)
instructions: Mix the white chocolate and cocoa powder in a 500-ml Pyrex measuring cup.
Add the boiling water and let stand for five minutes.
Stir using a whisk.
Heat the milk and cream over medium heat in a small saucepan, about five minutes.
Pour the hot milk mixture over the chocolate mixture, whisking.
Add the hazelnut liqueur.
Divide the mixture between two cups.
Garnish with whipped cream, brittle, chocolate shavings and wafers.

name: Pumpkin Screwdriver
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) pumpkin purée (homemade or store-bought)
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the candies, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.

name: Punch citrus

instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the lime slices, in a punch bowl.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Pour into old-fashioned glasses.
Garnish each glass with blueberries and a lime slice.

name: Punch citrus, individual serving
ingredients: 25 ml (3/4 oz.) peach and bourbon liqueur
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the blueberries and the lime slice, in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with blueberries and the lime slice.

name: Punch on the Pier

In order, pour in the citrus liqueur, orange juice, grapefruit juice and vodka. To preserve the rainbow look, do not stir.

name: Punch on the Pier, individual serving

instructions: Place the fruit slices in a tulip glass containing a few ice cubes.
In order, pour in the citrus liqueur, orange juice, grapefruit juice and vodka.
To preserve the rainbow look, do not stir.

name: Purple Jesus

instructions: Combine all ingredients except the raspberry in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a shot glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the raspberry on a pick.

name: Québec 1837
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice cubes, add gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a flute using an ice strainer and sieve.
Top up with sparkling wine.

name: Quebec Mimosa

instructions: Combine the liqueur and syrup in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.

Top up with sparkling wine.

name: Québec punch!

instructions: Pour all liquid ingredients in a punch bowl.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add the fruits and orange juice ice cubes.
Pour into highball glasses.
Garnish each glass with an apple slice.

name: Québec punch!, individual serving
ingredients: 40 ml (1 1/3 oz.) whisky and maple liqueur (like Sortilège)
instructions: Pour all liquid ingredients in a highball glass.

Add the citrus wedges and orange juice ice cubes.
Garnish with an apple slice.

name: Quebec sangria

In a two-litre pitcher, combine the macerated fruit and liquid with the sparkling cider and soda.
Fill with ice cubes.
Garnish with mint leaves.
Use a ladle to serve.

name: Queen Bee

instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the lemon slice and cinnamon stick, in a toddy glass.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lemon slice and cinnamon stick.

name: Queen of hearts
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the cherry, in a highball glass filled with ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a cherry.
Pro tip:
* Black-cherry soda is available at most grocery stores.

name: Quiet One
instructions: Combine all ingredients, in a blender containing ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into an old-fashioned glass.

name: Raphaëlle
instructions: In a shaker, combine the aperitif wine, vodka and pear nectar.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with wedge of orange and pear.

name: Rasberry Spook
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) raspberry liqueur (like Sour Puss)
instructions: Pour the raspberry beverage into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with the lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with the lime zest.

name: Raspberry Bellini
instructions: Combine the vodka and raspberry purée in a chilled flute glass.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish with a raspberry on a cocktail pick.

name: Raspberry Collins
instructions: Combine dry gin, lemon juice, syrup and 3 raspberries in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with tonic water.
Garnish with a slice of lime and the remaining 3 raspberries.

name: Raspberry Collins, punch version
instructions: Combine dry gin, lemon juice, cane syrup (simple syrup) and raspberries in a large punch bowl.

Pour into highball glasses containing ice cubes until one-third full.

Add the soda at the last minute ensure the drink is bubbly enough.

name: Raspberry Daiquiri
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for one strawberry, in a blender containing ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a daiquiri glass.
Garnish with a raspberry on a cocktail pick.

name: Raspberry Lemonade
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the toppings, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with lemon slices and raspberries.

name: Raspberry Lime
