Add a few ice cubes.
Pour in the raspberry-flavoured rum, cane syrup and lime juice.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with remaining raspberries and mint leaves.

name: Raspberry Orange
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) raspberry liqueur (like Sour Puss)
instructions: Combine the raspberry liqueur and orange juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with raspberries and an orange wedge.

name: Raspberry Rave
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a blender except one raspberry.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a martini glass.
Garnish with the remaining raspberry on a pick.

name: Raspberry Whisky Royal
instructions: Combine the whisky and cranberry juice in a shaker ﬁlled with ice cubes.
Add the raspberry purée.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Garnish with the 2 raspberries.

name: Rasptini
instructions: Combine the raspberry-flavoured vodka, citrus liqueur and raspberry coulis in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a flute using an ice strainer.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish with the raspberries and mint leaf on a pick.

name: Rasta Delight
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the mango slices, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with mango slices.

name: Rebel Lemonade
instructions: Pour the scotch and the lemonade into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with 3 lemon slices.

name: Red Desert
instructions: Pour the wine in a martini glass.
Combine the ice cube, vodka and sorbet in a shaker.
Add lemon juice and one basil leaf.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the remaining basil leaf.

name: Red Dragon
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) passion fruit and cognac beverage (like Alizé Gold)
15 ml (1/2 oz.) sweet and sour syrup
instructions: Pour all the ingredients except the slice of lime into a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the slice of lime.
Pro tip:
Sweet and Sour syrup:
125 ml (1/2 cup) simple syrup
125 ml (1/2 cup) lime juice
125 ml (1/2 cup) lemon juice
Combine the simple syrup, lime juice and lemon juice.
- Stir the ingredients.
- Keep refrigerated.

name: Red Velvet
instructions: Combine the american whisky and raspberry liqueur in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with lemon-lime soda.

name: Redhead
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) freshly squeezed clementine juice
instructions: Combine the vodka, clementine juice and cranberry juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.
Add the club soda.
Garnish according to your inspiration.

name: Redwood
instructions: Combine the rum, strawberry liqueur and Angostura bitters in an old-fashioned glass containing the ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Squeeze lemon zest over glass and use as garnish.

name: Refreshing Punch
ingredients: 50 ml (1 2/3 oz.) of cane syrup (simple syrup)
instructions: In a punch bowl containing ice cubes, combine all the ingredients except a few cucumber slices.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Serve into highball glasses.
Garnish each glass with a slice of cucumber.

name: Refreshing Punch, individual serving
ingredients: A dash of cane syrup (simple syrup)
instructions: In an highball glass containing a few ice cubes, combine all the ingredients except a slice of cucumber.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a cucumber slice.

name: Reggae Cream
instructions: Combine the marula fruit cream liqueur and the rum in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Relay
ingredients: 30 mL (1 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice, pour all ingridients.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into a highball glass.
Garnish with the kumquat slices.

name: Remix
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the cherry, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the cherry on a pick.

name: Rhubarb Royale
ingredients: 1 bottle sparkling wine(or carbonated water), chilled
instructions: SERVES 6
Place the rhubarb and sugar in a 500 ml (2 cups) Mason jar and crush using a muddler.
Add vodka and almond liqueur and allow to macerate overnight in the refrigerator.
Strain using a sieve, pressing to get as much juice as possible.
Divide among six julep or highball glasses.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish with mint stems.

name: Rhum-Cocoa
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the coffee beans, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
Strain into a chilled martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with coffee beans.

name: Rio Rusky
instructions: Combine the lime cubes and maple syrup in an old-fashioned glass, and crush using a pestle.
Add the crushed ice cubes.
Pour the vodka and stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Riviera
instructions: Pour the anise-flavoured spirit, dry gin and club soda into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with the lemonade.
Squeeze the lemon wedge into the glass.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Rob Collins
instructions: Combine the vodka, elderberry liqueur and lemon juice into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with the lemon slice.

name: Rob Roy
instructions: Combine ice cubes, Scotch, red vermouth and Angostura bitters in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
Did you know:
The Rob Roy is a variation of the Manhattan, which is made from Scotch only. It's named after Scotland's infamous outlaw hero from the 18th Century, Robert Roy Mac Gregor.

name: Rose
instructions: Combine all ingredients except the rose petals in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the rose petals.

name: Rose Melon
instructions: Place 4 watermelon balls and the mint leaves in a shaker and crush with a muddler.
Add the syrup and ice cubes.
Pour in the dry gin, lemon juice and rose water.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a tulip glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with 3 watermelon balls and the sprig of mint on a cocktail pick.

name: Rosebud
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8–10 seconds.
Strain over a shooter glass using an ice strainer.

name: Rosini
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) lychee and raspberry liqueur
instructions: Pour the lychee and raspberry liqueur into a highball glass.
Slowly add the sparkling wine.
Garnish with a raspberry on a cocktail pick.

name: Roska Punch
ingredients: 250 ml (8 oz.) honeydew, diced or in balls
instructions: Combine ingredients in a large punch bowl.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses containing a few ice cubes.

name: Rosso Tonic
instructions: In a shaker filled with ice cubes, add the vermouth and fill with tonic water.
Shake gently so as not to burst the bubbles.
Pour the shaker's content into an old-fashioned glass.
Squeeze orange quarter, then place it in the glass.

name: Royal kir
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) blackcurrant liqueur (crème de cassis)
instructions: Pour the blackcurrant liqueur and the well-chilled sparkling wine into a flute.

name: Royal splash
ingredients: wedge of orange or piece of pineapple
instructions: Pour Canadian whisky, pineapple juice, and cranberry juice into a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously to chill the mixture well.
Pour into a glass with the ice.
Garnish with a wedge of orange or a piece of pineapple.

name: Royal strawberry
instructions: Pour the strawberry liqueur into a flute.
Top up with champagne.

name: Royal Surprise
instructions: Combine the whisky, peach liqueur and cranberry juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into an old-fashioned glass.
Garnish with the cranberries.

name: Rum & Cranberry
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) white or gold rum 90 ml
instructions: Pour the rum into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with cranberry juice.
Squeeze one lime wedge over the glass.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with two lime wedges.

name: Rum and Soda
instructions: Combine the white rum and club soda in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lemon slice and berries.

name: Rum Coffee
instructions: Rim a toddy glass with water and sugar.
Add the rum and Irish cream liqueur.
Top it up with hot espresso coffee.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with whipped cream and coffee beans.

name: Rum Cola
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) white or amber rum
instructions: Pour the rum into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with cola.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Rum Rickey
instructions: Combine amber rum and lime juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with a slice of lime.

name: Rum Runner
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Rum Sidecar
instructions: Pour the rum, citrus liqueur and lime juice into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a quarter of a lime and orange.

name: Rum Treat
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.

name: Russian tropic
instructions: In an electric blender, dissolve the sugar in the water.
Add the strawberries, kiwi, vodka and ice cubes.
Mix on low until smooth.
Pour into an old-fashioned glass.
Garnish with the kiwi slice, strawberry slice and mint leaf.

name: Rustic charm
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the lemon slice, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with the lemon slice.

name: Rusty Nail
instructions: In an old-fashioned glass filled with ice, combine Scotch and herb liqueur (like Drambuie).
Stir with mixing spoon.
Garnish with slice of lemon.

name: S'mores Coffee
instructions: Combine the coffee and vodkas in a coffee cup.
Add milk or cream, if desired.
Top with marshmallows.
Place the cup on a baking sheet and brown the marshmallows under the broiler for a few seconds, keeping the oven door open. Alternatively, brown with a kitchen torch.
Drizzle with chocolate sauce and sprinkle with graham-cracker crumbs.

name: Sacré printemps
ingredients: 120 ml (4 oz.) Celestial Seasonings tea with hibiscus (or Celestial Seasonings Pomegranate Rooibos), infused and chilled
instructions: Combine all the ingredients into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with dragon-fruit slice and basil leaves.

name: Sahara
ingredients: Sugar and smoked paprika, for frosting the glass rim
instructions: Frost a martini glass by moistenning first the rim of the glass with a lemon slice and then dipping it into a mixture of sugar and smoked paprika. Set aside.
Combine the marula cream, almond liqueur and milk in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Add the pinch of smoked paprika.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the glass.

name: Sake Martini
instructions: Combine the dry gin, sake and ginger slice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with an olive on a pick.

name: Salsa
instructions: Combine the whiskey, citrus liqueur and orange juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with ginger ale.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a piece of crystallized ginger and a lime slice.

name: Salty Dog
instructions: Rim the martini glass with fine salt.
Combine vodka and grapefruit juice and in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain over glass using an ice strainer.

name: Samba coco
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the orange zest, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange zest.

name: Sangria
instructions: In a punch bowl or pitcher, combine all the ingredients.
Mix ingredients together with a mixing spoon.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses with a few ice cubes and some fruit from the bowl.
Did you know:

Did you know: that this classic summer punch gets its name from its dark red colour? Appearing first in Spain, the drink quickly became very popular among the locals, who named it Sangria, which means «bleeding» in Spanish

name: Sangria Blanco, individual serving
instructions: Combine all the ingredients into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Sangria Blanco, punch version
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a punch bowl or a pitcher.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with lemon and lime slices from the punch bowl.

name: Sangria du terroir, individual serving
instructions: In order, pour the orange juice, honey wine, white rum and red wine into a wine glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with a few raspberries and blueberries.

name: Sangria du terroir, punch version
instructions: Fill a pitcher half full with ice.
Add the fruit.
In order, pour in the orange juice, honey wine, white rum and red wine.
Top up with lemon-lime soda.
Serve in wine glasses containing a few ice cubes, raspberries and blueberries.

name: Santa Sour
instructions: Combine all ingredients the raspberry in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Set aside for 4 minutes, then shake again before serving.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a raspberry on a pick.

name: SAQ Celebration
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the blueberries, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with frozen blueberries.

name: Scarlet Supreme
instructions: Rim a highball glass with the celery salt.
Add the ice cubes.
Pour in the dry gin and tomato juice.
Add the Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco and pepper.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the cherry tomato and lemon slice on a cocktail pick.

name: Scarlett Passion
instructions: Put the strawberries in a shaker and crush them with a pestle.
Add the rest of the ingredients (except the orange twist).
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Squeeze the orange twist over the drink and then hang it on the rim of the glass for garnish.

name: Scorpion
instructions: Combine amber rum, mango and lime juices in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with half a strawberry.

name: Scottish Apple
instructions: Combine scotch, apple juice and lemon juice in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with apple slices.

name: Scottish coffee
instructions: Combine the citrus liqueur and scotch into a toddy glass.
Add the hot coffee.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with whipped cream and a slice of orange.

name: Screwdriver
instructions: Mix vodka and orange juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with an orange wedge.
Did you know:
Like many other cocktails, the Screwdriver dates back to the American prohibition. Construction workers snuck vodka into their orange juice and used their screwdrivers to mix the beverage.

name: Sea Breeze
instructions: Combine ice cubes, vodka, cranberry and grapefruit juices in a shaker.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into highball glass using an ice strainer.
Squeeze lime wedge gently over the glass.
Place lime wedge in the glass.

name: Sea Star
instructions: Combine the anise liqueur and pineapple juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a starfuit slice and a star anise

name: Sex on the beach
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the orange slice and maraschino cherry, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the orange slice and maraschino cherry on a cocktail pick.
Did you know:

There are thousands of different recipes bearing the name Sex on the Beach. It's not all that surprising when you consider the selling power of the word «sex»! That's also why so many bartenders appropriated the name of the original recipe to use for their own concoctions.

name: Shamrock
ingredients: A splash of green mint syrup
instructions: Combine the whiskey, cranberry juice and mint syrup in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a beer glass using an ice strainer.
Slowly add the beer, pouring it down the side of the glass to create a layered cocktail.
Pro tip:
Heads up! One of the characteristics of stout is its creamy head of foam, which preserves the flavours and makes them that much more enjoyable.

name: Shanghai green tea
instructions: Combine the vodka, iced green tea and sugar in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add the juice from the lemon wedge.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lemon slices and mint leaves.

name: Shirley Temple
instructions: Combine ice cubes, lemon-lime soda and grenadine in a highball glass.
Mix using a mixing spoon.
Squeeze the lime wedge over the glass.
Place the lime wedge and maraschino cherry in the glass.
DID YOU KNOW
This refreshing cocktail was created in the 30s in honour of child star Shirley Temple. Given her young age, bartenders around the world served her this non-alcoholic drink.

name: Shooting Star, punch version
ingredients: 1/2 basket of raspberries (170 g), for garnish
1/2 basket of blueberries (170 g), for garnish
1/2 basket of blackberries (170 g), for garnish
instructions: Bring the water to a boil in a saucepan containing the star anise.
Remove from burner, cover and leave to infuse for five minutes.
Pour into a punch bowl.
Add the remaining liquid ingredients.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish each glass with fresh fruits.

name: Sidecar
instructions: Pour brandy, lemon juice and citrus liqueur in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Filter over a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a twist of orange.
Did you know:

This cocktail, which offers the perfect blend of strong, sweet and sour tastes, was created in 1931 by Harry MacElhone, a popular bartender in London and Paris. A survivor of World War I, he dubbed the cocktail the «Sidecar» as a tribute to his former captain, who always used this form of transportation.

name: Silkiest
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a highball glass.

name: Siren
instructions: Pour the tequila, lemon juice and oyster juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with tonic water.
Garnish with lime wedges.

name: Ski Hill Soother
instructions: Rim the edge of a toddy glass with sugar.
Add brandy and coffee.
Garnish with whipped cream.
Decorate with coffee beans.

name: Slalom
ingredients: A splash of grenadine or cherry liqueur
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a blender, except the grenadine.
Blend until smooth.
Pour two-thirds of the mixture in a old-fashioned glass.
Add the grenadine to the remaining preparation, and blend again.
Pour this mixture into the glass, to form a second layer.
Garnish with a raspberry on a pick.

name: Slush-tails ice blue slushie
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the tonic water, lime juice, citrus liqueur and gin, and mix together.
Pour this mixture into a 38 x 25 cm (15 x 10 in.) Pyrex dish.
Freeze for 1 hour and then break up the mixture with a fork, scraping down the sides.
Put everything back into the freezer and repeat these steps 3 to 5 times, breaking up the ice every 30 minutes, or until it becomes granulated.
When it’s time to serve, put the mixture into cups (you’ll have about 4 servings) with a straw and an orange slice.

name: Smoothie Goodness
instructions: Combine all ingredients in the blender except for one strawberry.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a highball glass.
Garnish with the remaining strawberry.

name: Snazzy Zest
instructions: Combine all liquid ingredients in a margarita glass filled with ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish according to your inspiration.

name: Snowflake
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the watermelon and the mint, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with watermelon cubes and a mint leaf.

name: So Great
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the pineapple slice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the pineapple slice.

name: So Great, punch version
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, previously chilled, in a pitcher.
Pour into martini glasses.
Garnish each glass with a pineapple slice.

name: SoCo Lime & Soda
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) peach and bourbon liqueur
A splash of sweet lime juice
instructions: Pour the peach and bourbon liqueur into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Add the sweet lime juice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the 3 lime slices.

name: Soho ginger
instructions: Pour the lychee liqueur into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with the ginger ale.
Slowly add the grenadine syrup, pouring it down the side of the glass to create a layered cocktail.
Garnish with a lychee.

name: Sour Sicilan
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) freshly squeezed lemon juice
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the cherry, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a cherry.

name: Spanish Coffee
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) amber or white rum
instructions: Combine coffee liqueur and rum in a toddy glass.
Fill with glass with coffee.
Top with whipped cream.
Garnish with coffee bean.

name: Sparkle & Shine
ingredients: A few drops of vanilla extract
instructions: Combine all liquid ingredients in a highball glass containing the ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with fruits.

name: Sparkle & Shine, punch version
instructions: Combine all liquid ingredients in a pitcher containing the ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add the fruits.
Serve in highball glasses.

name: Sparkling Anise
instructions: Pour the anise liqueur in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with cola.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a star anise.

name: Sparkling Ginger
instructions: Combine the American whiskey and ginger ale in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lime slice.

name: Sparkling Honey
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the melon ball, in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the melon ball on a pick.

name: Sparkling Honey, punch version
instructions: Combine all the ingredients (previously chilled), except for the melon balls, in a pitcher.
Pour into old-fashioned glasses.
Garnish each glass with a melon ball on a pick.

name: Sparkling Pear
instructions: Combine the raspberries and sugar in an old-fashioned glass and crush using a muddler.
Add ice cubes.
Pour vodka, lemon juice and club soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a sprig of mint.

name: Sparkling Rose
instructions: Combine vodka, cranberry juice and vanilla in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain over flute using ice strainer.
Top up with sparkling wine.

name: Sparkling Singapore
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) plum liqueur (like sloe gin) or cherry liqueur (like cherry brandy)
instructions: Combine, in this order, grenadine syrup, lemon juice, pineapple juice, dry gin and fruit liqueur in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with club soda, leaving a few centimetres at the top.
Flavour with a small amount of citrus liqueur.
Garnish with pineapple and cherries.
Did you know:

In 1913 Ngiam Tong Boon, bartender at the legendary Raffles Hotel in Singapore, created the Singapore Sling. The drink was somewhat forgotten during the 30s, until 1936, when the hotel employees decided to recreate it using notes left behind by previous bartenders. Finally, it became fashionable in 1990, after the release of Singapore Sling, a movie by Nikos Nikolaidis. This cocktail is now served on all of Singapore's airlines.

name: Spice Forest
instructions: Place the tea bag and 2 pieces of orange zest in a mixing glass and add the boiling water.
Remove the tea bag after a minute and put the tea in the refrigerator.
Combine the white rum, citrus liqueur and orange juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add the tea and stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a pick and an orange zest.

name: Spiced Cider
instructions: Pour the rum and the cider in a toddy glass with a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.

name: Spiced Cuba Libre
instructions: Pour the spiced rum into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add cola.
Add squeezed lime wedge.
Stir gently using mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Spiced iced tea
instructions: Combine the rum and iced tea in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the 2 lime wedges.

name: Spicy apple
instructions: Pour the apple juice, maple syrup, ginger and ice into a shaker.
Shake vigorously until you produce a nice mousse.
Pour into glasses without ice.
Fill to the top with beer.
Garnish each glass with a slice of apple.
Recipe from Stéphane Morin’s book Panachés. Morin teaches sommellerie on top of being a beer historian.

name: Spicy Havana
instructions: Combine the rum, almond liqueur and lime juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime zest and cinnamon stick.

name: Spicy Mojito
instructions: Combine the mint leaves and lime juice in a highball glass.
Crush using a pestle.
Add sugar, spiced rum and ice cubes.
Top up with ginger ale.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish whith the half lime slice and mint leaf.

name: Spicy strawberry
ingredients: 1 strawberry and a small Thai chili skewered together
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the strawberry and chili, in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a margarita glass.4 Garnish with a strawberry and Thai chili.

name: Spicy Winter Punch
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl punch or pitcher containing ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses.

name: Splash
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the lemon wedge, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lemon wedge.

name: Spring Punch
instructions: Combine the rum, fruit juices and lemonade in a bowl containing ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Split a vanilla pod lengthwise, and add to the punch along with the orange and lime wheels.
Pour into old-fashioned glasses containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish each glass with an orange wheel.

name: Spring Punch, individual serving
instructions: In an old fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes, add all the ingredients except the orange wheel and the vanilla pod.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the orange wheel and vanilla pod.

name: Springtime Surprise
instructions: In a highball glass containing a few ice cubes, pour in the Cremovo first.
Slowly add the vodka, then the orange juice and the soda water in succession to make a layered cocktail.
Garnish with an orange wedge.
Did you know:
Cremovo is an Italian dessert wine made from Marsala wine and egg yolk. Typically drunk before or at the end of meals, it's adelicious addition to Easter parties.
– Erik Ayala, cocktail mixologist

name: Sprint
instructions: In a flute containing a few crushed ice cubes, pour the melon liqueur and the whiskey.
Top up with ginger ale.
Garnish with ground cherry, or berry fruit on a pick.

name: Spritzini
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) freshly squeezed orange juice
instructions: Combine the bitter liqueur, dry gin and the orange juice into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Stir a few minutes using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with rosemary sprig and orange-peel twist.

name: St-Tropez
instructions: Combine ingredients in shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a tulip glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with cherries and slice of orange.

name: Star of Bombay
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) sugar cane syrup (plain syrup)
instructions: In a shaker, crush the cantaloupe cubes using a pestle.
Add the gin, syrup and egg white.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Add the ice cubes and shake again vigorously.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.

name: Star studded kir
instructions: Divide the cider and sparkling water among 4 champagne flutes.
Add ¾ oz of crème de cassis to each glass.
Garnish each flute with a sprig of rosemary.

name: Star-studded Sangria, individual serving
instructions: One day before, place the orange zest and sections into ice cube trays, fill with water and set aside in the freezer.

In a saucepan, over medium heat, bring the orange juice, water, 15 ml (1/2 oz.) of sugar, one bay leave, the cinnamon and clove to a boil. Lower the heat and reduce the mixture by 2/3. Let cool and infuse.
Place some sugar in a saucer. Rub the edge of an old-fashioned glass with a slice of orange and dip into the sugar.
Place a few fruit ice cubes in the glass.
Add the red wine, vodka and spiced rum.
Add the syrup, passing it through a sieve placed above the glass.
Add the remaining bay leave.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a star fruit slice and an orange slice.

name: Star-studded Sangria, punch version
instructions: One day before, place the orange zest and sections into ice cube trays, fill with water and set aside in the freezer.

In a saucepan, over medium heat, bring the orange juice, water, 80 ml (2 2/3 oz.) of sugar, 2 or 3 bay leaves, the cinnamon and cloves to a boil. Lower the heat and reduce the mixture by 2/3. Let cool and infuse.
Combine the red wine, vodka and spiced rum in a punch bowl or pitcher.
Add the syrup, passing it through a sieve placed above the bowl.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add the remaining bay leaves.
Place some sugar in a saucer. Rub the edge of old-fashioned glasses with a slice of orange and dip into the sugar.
Place a few fruit ice cubes at the bottom of the glasses.
Fill the glasses with sangria and garnish with a few fruit slices.

name: Stinger
instructions: Pour ice cubes and all ingredients into an old fashioned glass.
Stir with mixing spoon 8 to 10 seconds.
Did you know:

A Stinger before dinner? Traditionally appreciated as a digestif, a number of celebrities began enjoying this cocktail prior to their evening meal in the 1920s. Then Reginald Vanderbilt, one of the prestigious and influential American Vanderbilts, introduced this practice at social soirées in New York.

name: Stinger Express
instructions: Pour the mint liqueur into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with the sprig of mint and orange zest.

name: Stopover
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the cherries and the orange, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with cherries and an orange wedge.

name: Storm
instructions: Combine rum and ginger ale in a highball glass filled with ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lime wedge and a slice of fresh ginger.

name: Strawberry Cake
instructions: Combine the liqueurs and milk in a shaker containing the ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a glass using an ice strainer.
Squeeze the orange twist over the drink to add flavour.
Garnish with the strawberry.

name: Strawberry Crush Gin
instructions: Place 3 cleaned and chopped strawberries in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add the gin and lemon-lime soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a strawberry.

name: Strawberry Daiquiri
instructions: Frost the rim of a margarita glass using water and sugar.
Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into the margarita glass.

name: Strawberry Kiss
instructions: Combine the vodka, raspberry liqueur and cranberry juice in shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a flute using an ice strainer.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish with a strawberry.

name: Strawberry Martini
instructions: Combine the strawberry cream liqueur and vodka in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a strawberry on a pick.

name: Strawberry Parfait
ingredients: Chocolate shavings or strawberries, as you wish
instructions: In a shaker glass filled with ice cubes, pour strawberry cream liqueur, vodka, and cream.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with chocolate shavings or strawberries, whichever you prefer.

name: Strawberry Shortcake
ingredients: 45 mL (1 1/2 oz) flavoured liquor (coconut, strawberries and whipped cream)
180 mL (6 oz) lemon or lime club soda
instructions: Combine flavoured liquor and lemon juice in a highball glass containing ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with strawberry slices and a lemon zest.

name: Strawberry Tonic
instructions: Place the sliced strawberries and basil leaves in a flute and lightly crush them with a muddler.
Add the ice cubes, dry gin and lemon juice.
Top up with tonic water.

name: Sublime
instructions: Combine the vodka and melon liqueur in a tumbler glass.
Place a lime slice in the glass, in order to create a tight wall above the vodka and melon liqueur.
Combine the pineapple juice, mango juice and lemon juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into the glass using an ice strainer and garnish with a lime slice.

name: Sugar Ball
instructions: In an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes, combine the maple syrup cream liqueur and milk.
Garnish with a stick of crystallized sugar.

name: Sugar Kiss
instructions: Combine the vodka and lime juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Place some cotton candy in the glass.
Pour the cranberry juice on the cotton candy in order to dissolve it.
Garnish with lemon zests or a piece of cotton candy.

name: Summer Cottage
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the cream, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with cream.

name: Summer Delight
ingredients: 45 ml (1 1/2 oz.) raspberry liqueur (like Sour Puss)
instructions: Place the raspberries in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add the raspberry beverage and top up with club soda.
Garnish with the pineapple slice.

name: Summer granita
ingredients: 4 x 355 ml vodka-based lemon and lime soda coolers
instructions: In a large, shallow dish, pour the vodka coolers.
Place in the freezer for at least 6 hours, or until mixture is frozen.
Before serving, scratch the surface of the granita with a fork to form small crystals.
Divide into chilled glasses and garnish with mint leaves and lime slices.

name: Summer Lightning, punch version
instructions: Combine the vodka and cranberry juice in a pitcher containing the fruits.
Let stand for five minutes.
Just before serving, add the ice cubes.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Stir gently using a mixing spoon.
Pour into highball glasses.

name: Summer Nectar
ingredients: 2 cups frozen berries (blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, etc.)
instructions: Combine vodka, lime juice and agave nectar in a pitcher or bowl punch. Add half the fruits. Cover, refrigerate and allow to macerate overnight. Add ice cubes, tonic water and the remaining fruits. Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Summer Raspberry
instructions: Combine the vodka, iced tea and 2 mint leaves in a blender containing ice cubes.
Blend until smooth.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Top up with tonic water.
Garnish with a mint leaf and a raspberry on a cocktail pick.

name: Sun Punch
ingredients: 120 ml (4 oz) raspberry liqueur (or raspberry syrup)
Red and yellow raspberries, to taste
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the orange juice in a large pitcher containing the ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Slowly add the orange juice to obtain a color gradient.
Stir again just before serving.

name: Sungarita, individual serving
instructions: Place all the ingredients, except for the half-slice of lemon, in a margarita glass.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the half-slice of lemon.

name: Sungarita, punch version
instructions: Place all the ingredients, except for the half-slices of lemon, in a pitcher.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Pour into margarita glasses.
Garnish each glass with a half-slice of lemon.

name: Sunny Breeze
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the grapefruit wedge, in a highball glass containing crushed ice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.

name: Sunny Garden
instructions: Combine the brandy, soda and lime juice in an old-fashioned glass containing the ice cubes.
Slowly add the melon liqueur to make a layered cocktail.
Squeeze the lime zest over the glass and drop it into the drink as garnish.

name: Sunset
instructions: Combine the vodka, lemon-lime soda and lemon juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Carefully pour the red vermouth down the side of the glass so it settles at the bottom and doesn't mix with the other liquids.
Add two drops of Angostura bitters.
Garnish with the kiwi slice.

name: Sunshine Sangria
ingredients: 120 mL (4 oz) Peachtree Schnapps peach liqueur
250 mL (1 cup) white grapes, half sliced
instructions: Combine the peach liqueur, brandy, wine and grape juice in a punch bowl. Add the fresh herbs and grapes.
Refrigerate and let steep four hours.
Remove from refrigerator and add the ice cubes.

name: Sweet & sour martini
instructions: Chill the martini glass in the freezer for 1 hour.
Roll the strawberry in the balsamic vinegar reduction and place it in the glass.
Add the vodka and orange juice.
Garnish with the orange wedge.

name: Sweet Dragon
instructions: Combine all ingredients except the lychee in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lychee on a pick.

name: Sweet Shiver
instructions: In an old-fashioned glass, mix the irish cream liqueur and the ice cream until it reaches a frothy consistency.
Serve with a small/mini-spoon.

name: Sweet Tooth
instructions: Pour the absinthe liqueur into a mixing glass.
Add the piece of ginger.
Crush using a muddler.
Rim a toddy glass with sugar and some of the absinthe liqueur.
Strain into the toddy glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with the hot chocolate.
Garnish with the whipped cream, a pinch of Espelette pepper and a few chocolate chips.

name: Sweet Tornado
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the orange zest.

name: Tak
instructions: With a pestle or spoon, lightly crush a sprig of thyme in a shaker.
Add the ice cubes, vodka and sherry.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with the chilled apple juice.
Garnish with the other thyme sprig and the cucumber slice.

name: Tangerine Screwdriver
instructions: Combine the vodka, orange-tangerine juice and lemon juice in a highball glass filled with ice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Add the blood-orange juice if desired.
Garnish with an orange slice.

name: Tango-Red
instructions: Combine the cognac and petals in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Add the peach liqueur and bitter liqueur.
Top up with lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with pieces of peach and a few petals.

name: Tech Tonic
instructions: Combine the dry gin and fruit beverage in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain over a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with soda.
Garnish with blueberries.

name: Tequila Caesar
ingredients: A few drops of Worcestershire sauce
A few drops of red Tabasco sauce
instructions: Frost the rim of a highball glass with the celery salt.
Combine all the ingredients, except for the lime quarter and the jalapeño, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lime quarter and jalapeño.

name: Tequila Pop
instructions: Combine the tequila, cranberry juice and lemon syrup in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Top up with sparkling wine.
Garnish with the pineapple leaf and slice.

name: Tequila Sun
instructions: Frost the rim of a martini glass with sugar.
Combine the tequila, citrus liqueur and orange juice in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.

name: Tequila Sunrise
instructions: Pour the tequila and orange juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Pour in the grenadine syrup.
Garnish with an orange slice and mint leaf.
Did you know:

This cocktail was invented in the 1970s by a SanFrancisco bartender. After a long night of drinking at his workplace, he told his boss that he had waited for the sunrise to inspire him and claimed he created the drink just as the sun came up.

name: Tequila Sunset
instructions: Combine all ingredients in the blender except the slice of lemon.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into an old-fashioned glass.
Garnish with the lemon slice.

name: Thallini
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Place the basil leaves in a shaker and crush coarsely using a pestle.
Add the ice cubes.
Also add the rum and coconut beverage, pineapple juice and mirin.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a champagne glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a sprig of basil and a grapefruit slice.
Pro tip:
* Mirin is available in grocery stores.

name: The Elephant
ingredients: 15 mL (1/2 oz) orgeat syrup* (or almond liqueur)
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a blender except for the lemon twists.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into martini glasses.
Garnish the glasses with lemon twists.

name: The Emperor
instructions: Combine the sake and mead in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a wine glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a slice of kiwi.

name: The Fleur-de-lys
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) sparkling cider of the ''Fruity and vibrant'' taste tag
instructions: In a shaker, crush the cranberries using a pestle.
Add some ice cubes, maple syrup, fresh lemon juice and the gin.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Double filter into a flute glass using an ice strainer and a pulp strainer.
Top up with sparkling cider.
Express a zest of grapefruit and garnish with it.

name: The Glades
instructions: SYRUP:
In a large measuring cup, combine the boiling water, sugar, peppercorns, ginger and turmeric until syrupy.
Let cool completely and strain.
COCKTAIL:
Fill a shaker with ice cubes, add the vodka, strained syrup, lemon juice and Angostura.
Shake vigorously, and pour into four martini glasses.

name: The Irishman
instructions: Combine the Irish cream liqueur, vodka, chilled coffee, cream and ice cubes in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the chocolate shavings.

name: The Irishman, punch version
instructions: Combine the Irish cream liqueur, vodka, chilled coffee and cream in a pitcher and add the ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Serve in martini glasses and garnish with the chocolate shavings.

name: The King
instructions: In a beer glass, combine the tomato juice, orange juice and gin with a pinch of salt and a few drops of hot sauce.
Add the ice cubes and fill with beer.
Thread a cocktail pick through the bacon slice, onion and gherkins and place in the glass.

name: The Madinina
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the starfruit slice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Garnish with the starfruit slice.

name: The Mexican
instructions: In a shaker, crush coriander, lime and 2 jalapeno slices using a muddler.
Add tequila, mango nectar and ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Garnish with jalapeno slices.

name: The Neapolitan
ingredients: 15 mL (1/2 oz) Toschi Fragoli wild strawberry liqueur
instructions: Place the strawberries in an old-fashioned glass and mash with a pestle.
Add the chocolate vodka and strawberry liqueur.
Stir.
Add the ice cubes, fill with soda and garnish with the vanilla pod.

name: The Quebec Royal
ingredients: 105 ml (3 ½ oz.) sparkling cider of the ''Fruity and sweet'' taste tag
instructions: Combine all ingredients except the thyme and the lemon in a wine glass containing a few ice cubes. Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a sprig of thyme and a lemon wedge.

name: The Quebec Sour
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) Canadian whisky (preferably of the ''Medium-bodied and woody'' taste tag)
45 ml (1 ½ oz.) fresh old-fashioned apple juice
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker except the apple slice.
Dry shake a few seconds.
Add ice cubes and shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a thin slice of apple, placing it gently on the top of the cocktail.

name: The rosé
instructions: Pour cider directly into a champagne flute or wine glass.
Carefully add the cranberry syrup and cherry bitter (the syrup will settle at the bottom of the glass, creating a gorgeous gradient colour).
Garnish with a few basil leaves and lemon zest.

name: The Sensass
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) passion fruit and cognac liqueur
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the tonic water and lime slice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Top up with tonic water.
Garnish with the lime slice on a cocktail pick.

name: The sparkling
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) strawberry and ginger syrup
instructions: In a 360 ml (12 oz.) Collins or Zombie glass, add all ingredients.
Top up with the tonic soda.
Stir using a bar spoon.
Garnish with a flower for an added burst of freshness.

name: The Spot
ingredients: 70 g (2 1/2 oz.) melted dark chocolate (minimum 60% cocoa)
6 to 7 fresh raspberries (save one for garnish)
instructions: Bring water and sugar to a boil in a saucepan.
Let the syrup cool in the refrigerator.
Melt the chocolate in a microwave.
Combine the syrup, melted chocolate and raspberries in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Filter into a rockglass or old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using a sieve.
Garnish with a fresh raspberry.

name: The Ultimate Caesar
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the lime quarter and the celery stick, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the lime quarter and celery stick.

name: The Vineyard
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) sugar cane syrup (simple syrup)
instructions: Place 6 grapes in a shaker and crush them with a muddler.
Fill the shaker with ice.
Add all other ingredients, except the remaining 3 grapes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Cut the remaining grapes into halves and use as garnish.

name: The YETI
ingredients: 15 ml (½ oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue Curaçao)
instructions: Combine the dry gin and the lemonade in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes. Add the citrus liqueur. Top up with de club soda. Stir using a mixing spoon. Garnish with a lemon wedge.

name: Thunder
instructions: Combine the vodka, tonic water and lemon juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Slowly pour the pomegranate liqueur down the inner side of the glass so that it settles at the bottom and doesn't mix too much with the other ingredients.
Garnish with the lemon slice.

name: Ti-punch
instructions: Place all the ingredients in an old-fashioned glass and crush using a muddler.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Serve without ice cubes.

name: Tiramisu
instructions: Combine the rum and chocolate liqueur into a glass (or a glass mug).
Add the whipped cream.
Carefully pour the hot coffee down the inside of the glass to create a layered cocktail.
Sprinkle with cocoa.
Garnish with the ladyfinger, if desired.

name: Tokyo Drift
instructions: In a shaker, crush some cilantro leaves in the cucumber syrup using a pestle.
Add the ice cubes, vodka, lime juice and simple syrup.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a magarita glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with cilantro.

name: Tom & Jerry
instructions: Combine amber rum, cognac, egg, syrup, cinnamon and cloves in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into toddy glass.
Add boiling water.
Stir for a few seconds with a mixing spoon.
Top with whipped cream

name: Tom Collins
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the half-lemon slice, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a half lemon slice.

name: Tomato
instructions: Combine the anise-flavoured spirit and grenadine syrup in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with water.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a half lemon slice.

name: Tonic Herbs
instructions: Pour the herb liqueur in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Tonus
instructions: Combine the lemon liqueur, vodka and cranberry juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with tonic water.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with lemon wedges and sliced cranberries.

name: Très Tangerine
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) aperitif wine (like Pineau des Charentes)
instructions: Crush 4 or 5 mint leaves in a highball glass using a muddler.
Add the ice cubes, aperitif and tangerine juice.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with the orange and the remaining mint leaves.
Pro tip:
For something a little different, you can use blood orange juice instead of tangerine juice.

name: Triple Citrus
instructions: Place the lime, orange and lemon slices in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Add the dry gin.
Top up with the club soda.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Triple Threat
instructions: Combine strawberry puree, lemon juice, mint leaves and sugar, in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Slowly add cream, then rum.
Garnish with a sprig of mint.

name: Tropical Breeze
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) rum and coconut beverage
instructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Tropical Coffee
ingredients: 30 ml (1 oz.) rum and banana beverage
instructions: Combine all ingredients except the strawberry and banana slice in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the strawberry and banana slice.

name: Tropical Jerry
instructions: Pour the rum, pineapple juice and grapefruit juice into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with the quarter-slice of grapefruit and a «hard to open» cocktail umbrella.

name: Tropical Paradise
instructions: Combine the white rum, peach liqueur and orange juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Slowly pour the mint syrup down the inner side of the glass so that it settles at the bottom and doesn't mix too much with the other ingredients.
Garnish with mint leaves and a slice of starfruit.

name: Tropical Storm
instructions: Combine the vodka, pineapple juice, cranberry juice and grenadine syrup in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the pineapple slice and maraschino cherry.

name: Tropical Storm, punch version
instructions: Combine the vodka, pineapple juice, cranberry juice, grenadine syrup and pineapple slices in a punch bowl and add the ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses and garnish each glass with a maraschino cherry.

name: Tropical Sweetness
instructions: Combine all liquid ingredients in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a peach slice and pineapple leaves.

name: Tropical thunder
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the angostura bitters, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Garnish with drops of Angostura bitters.

name: Turquoise Jewel
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
15 ml (1/2 oz.) white or dark rum
instructions: Combine citrus liqueur and rum in a wine glass containing ice cubes.
Top up with pineapple juice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a kiwi slice.

name: Tweed
ingredients: A few drops of Angostura bitters
instructions: Combine all ingredients minus the orange twist in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with an orange twist on a pick.

name: Twist
instructions: Combine the marula cream and lemon liqueur in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
If desired, tint the drink by adding a drop of blue and green food colouring.
Garnish with the lemon twist.

name: Uppercut
instructions: Combine almond liqueur and vodka in a shot glass.
Pour orange juice into an old-fashioned glass.
Place the shot glass inside the old-fashioned glass.
Drink all at once.

name: Urban lemon
instructions: In a highball glass, combine the lemon liqueur, calvados and lemon juice.
Mix well.
Fill the glass with ice cubes and top up with soda.
Garnish with the lemon slice on a cocktail stick.

name: Vampire
instructions: In a highball glass containing a few ice cubes, pour the whiskey and cranberry juice.
Top up slowly with the beer, to create a layered effect.
Garnish with a cherry on a cocktail pick.

name: Vanilla Breeze
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the cranberries, in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with cranberries on a cocktail pick.

name: Vanilla Chip
ingredients: 120 ml (4 oz.) eggnog (optional: heat and whisk to obtain foam)
instructions: Pour the cream beverage and eggnog in an old-fashioned glass.
Garnish with grated nutmeg.
Serve with a chocolate chip cookie on a cocktail pick.

name: Vanilla coffee
instructions: Pour the vanilla liqueur and the Irish creamy beverage into a "toddy" glass.
Add the hot coffee.
Garnish with whipped cream chocolate shavings.
Pro tip:

Bring originality to your cocktail and shake the herb and vanilla liqueur and the Irish creamy beverage in shaker filled with ice cubes. First, pour the hot coffee into a toddy glass. Then, add the whipped cream. Finally, pour the mix from the shaker. You will be surprised to see the whipped cream go up to the top of your glass. What an impressive "hot-cold" effect!

name: Vanilla cream coffee
instructions: Pour the cream into a "toddy" glass.
Top with coffee.
Garnish with whipped cream.

name: Vanilla Soda
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the vanilla pod, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a vanilla pod.

name: Vanilla Sour
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the pineapple slice, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a pineapple slice.

name: Vanitini
instructions: Combine the vodka, hazelnut liqueur and lemon-lime soda in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lemon slice on a cocktail pick.

name: Velvet Hammer
instructions: Combine ice cubes, vodka, chocolate liqueur and cream in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Sprinkle with chocolate shavings.

name: Velvety Pineapple
instructions: Combine the irish cream liqueur and pineapple juice in into a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a pineapple slice.

name: Verdunite
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except rosemary sprig, in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into wine glass using an ice strainer.
Decorate with rosemary sprig.

name: Very Berry
ingredients: 90 ml (3 oz.) cranberry and raspberry juice
instructions: Combine the dry gin, cranberry and raspberry juice and lemon juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds. Strain into a martini glass with an ice strainer.
Garnish with the raspberries.

name: Victory
ingredients: 60 ml (2 oz.) berry juice from fresh berries (strawberries, pomegranate, etc.)
instructions: Crush berries using a pestle.
Strain the crushed berries using a sieve.
Add lemon liqueur, berry juice and maple syrup in an INAO glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Garnish with mint leaves.

name: Violet
instructions: Pour the vodka, anis-flavoured spirit and grape juice in a highball glass containing the ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a violet.

name: Viva
instructions: Place the watermelon cubes and the ice cubes, alternating, in a Mason jar.
Slowly pour in the melon liqueur, the dry gin and the tonic water, in that order.
Garnish with a lime twist.

name: Vodka and Grape
instructions: Pour the vodka in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with grape juice.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with grapes.

name: Vodka Cranberry
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the lime wedge, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 secondes.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime wedge.

name: Vodka du Lac
ingredients: Fresh mint leaves (save some for garnish)
instructions: Muddle a few mint leaves in the bottom of a glass.
Add first four ingredients.
Fill with ice.
Top off with soda.
Garnish with a slice of lime, pinch of ground cardamom and a few fresh mint leaves.

name: Vodka Passion
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with frozen cranberries on a pick.

name: Vodka Passion
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) passion fruit and cognac beverage (like Alizé Gold)
The juice from a lime wedge
instructions: Combine all the ingredients except the lime wedge into a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a shot glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime wedge.

name: Vodka soda
instructions: Combine the vodka and soda club in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes and the lemon zest.
Stir using a mixing spoon.

name: Vodka sunrise
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the pineapple slice, in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Garnish with the pineapple slice.

name: Vodka sunset
instructions: Pour vodka and peach juice in a glass filled with ice.
Add equal parts of orange and cranberry juices.
Garnish with a slice of orange and some cranberries.
Serve with a straw.

name: Vodkatini
instructions: Combine ice cubes, vodka, and vermouth into a glass.
Stir with mixing spoon 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using ice strainer.
Garnish with lemon twist or olive.
Did you know:

This celebrated classic cocktail was popularized by James Bond, who made no secret of his favourite drink in the 1962 movie Dr. No. This variation on the world-renowned Dry Martini was the result of a partnership between Smirnoff vodka and the production company. Order your Vodkatini 007-style, «shaken, not stirred.»

name: Vodkir
ingredients: 4 ice cubes + 750 mL (3 cups) crushed ice
instructions: Fill 4 old-fashioned glasses with crushed ice.
In a cocktail shaker, combine the vodka, blackcurrant liqueur, ice cubes, basil leaves and lemon juice.
Shake vigorously for one minute. Strain through a sieve into the four glasses.

name: Vogue
instructions: Pour each of the cherry brandy, apple juice, grape juice and club soda over the back of a spoon into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes to form a layered cocktail.
Place one star anise in a shaker and crush using a muddler.
Add ice cubes and vodka.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.

name: Voodoo
ingredients: 10 ml (1/3 oz.) freshly squeezed lime juice
10 ml (1/3 oz.) sugar cane syrup (simple syrup)
instructions: Combine ingredients and ice cubes in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.

name: Warm-up
instructions: Pour whiskey and lime juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with spicy ginger ale.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Whipped Sunset
ingredients: 90 ml (3 oz.) sweet and sour syrup
instructions: Combine the vodka, sour mix and pineapple juice in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Add the grenadine syrup.
Garnish with whipped cream and a lemon zest.
Pro tip:
Sweet and Sour syrup:
125 ml (1/2 cup) simple syrup
125 ml (1/2 cup) lime juice
125 ml (1/2 cup) lemon juice
- Combine the simple syrup, lime juice and lemon juice.
- Stir the ingredients.
- Keep refrigerated.

name: Whiskey Cranberry
instructions: Combine the Irish whiskey and cranberry juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a lemon wedge and cranberries.

name: Whisky grog
ingredients: 1 tsp liquid honey or maple syrup
instructions: Combine whisky, lemon juice and honey in a toddy glass.
Add the cinnamon stick in the glass.
Top up with the boiling water.
Stir a few minutes using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with lemon zest.

name: Whisky Lemonade
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the mint leaves, in an old-fashioned glass containing ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with mint leaves.

name: Whisky Margarita
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the lime wedge, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a margarita glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with the lime wedge.

name: Whisky Sour
instructions: Combine ice cubes and all ingredients except cherry in a shaker filled with ice.
Shake vigorously 8 to 10 seconds.
Pour into old-fashioned glass.
Place maraschino cherry in the glass.

name: Whisky Twisty
instructions: Combine the whisky and cranberry juice in a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with ginger ale.
Stir with a mixing spoon.

name: Whispering Grass
instructions: Pour the vodka into an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with cream soda.
Garnish with the cherry.

name: White coffee
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the nutmeg, in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a toddy glass.
Garnish with nutmeg.

name: White Cookie
instructions: Pour all the liquid ingredients into a shaker.
Add the ice cubes and shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a chilled martini glass.
Serve accompanied by a brownie and strawberries.

name: White Cosmo
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the cranberries, in a shaker filled with ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with frozen cranberries on a cocktail pick.

name: White Cosmo, punch version
instructions: Combine all ingredients except cranberries in a punch bowl.
Serve in martini glasses.
Garnish with frozen cranberries.

name: White Lady
instructions: Combine ingredients and ice cubes in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Did you know:

In 1919, in London's Ciro's Club, bartender Harry MacElhone created the first White Lady, initially using white crème de menthe instead of gin. Four years later, when MacElhone was the owner of Harry's New York Bar, he modified the recipe, this time using equal parts gin, citrus liqueur and lemon juice.

name: White Oak
instructions: Pour the Irish whiskey into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes.
Top up with club soda.
Add a pressed lime wedge.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with the remaining lime wedge.

name: White russian
instructions: Put ice cubes in an old fashioned glass.
Carefully add vodka, coffee liqueur, and milk.
Did you know:

The White Russian is a just like a Black Russian, but with milk. Like its counterpart, the White Russian was considered by Russians to be for women and tourists only. It's thanks to these tourists that the White Russian became popular worldwide. What's more, the White Russian is The Dude's favourite drink in the Coen brothers' American cult film The Big Lebowski.

name: White Sangria, individual serving
instructions: Combine all the ingredients, except for the fruit slices, in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Add the fruit slices.

name: White Sangria, punch version
instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a punch bowl or pitcher.
Stir with a mixing spoon.
Serve in old-fashioned glasses containing a few ice cubes, adding fruit slices.

name: Wild Beauty
instructions: Place a few raspberries in a shaker and crush using a pestle.
Add ice cubes, vodka, raspberry juice, and raspberry liqueur.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass containing a few ice cubes using an ice strainer and a sieve.
Top up with lemon-lime soda.
Garnish with fresh raspberries and lemon zest.

name: Wild Crush
instructions: Combine the wild strawberry liqueur, white port and tonic water in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a maxing spoon.
Add the lime juice.
Garnish with the lime zest.

name: Winter Blues
ingredients: 15 ml (1/2 oz.) citrus liqueur (like blue curaçao)
instructions: Combine all ingredients, except for the sparkling water and cherries, in a shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake vigorously for one minute so that the egg whites are well incorporated. Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer. Top up with black cherry sparkling water. Garnish with maraschino cherries on a cocktail pick.

name: Winter Coffee
ingredients: Orange slice, candied orange or orange zest
instructions: Combine the coffee, spiced rum and citrus liqueur in a coffee cup.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with whipped cream, cinnamon stick and orange slice.

name: Winter strawberry hot chocolate
ingredients: 90 mL (3 oz) boiling water (plus some to preheat the cup)
120 mL (4 oz) hot milk (plus some to make milk foam, optional)
Strawberry marshmallows, homemade (or store-bought), for garnish
instructions: Preheat a 310-mL (10-oz) mug with some boiling water, one minute.
Pour out the water.
Place the chocolate chunks directly in the mug and pour in 90 mL (3 oz) of boiling water.
Whisk to melt the chocolate.
Add the salt and strawberry liqueur.
Top up with the hot milk.
Garnish with the milk foam, if desired, and a few marshmallows.

name: Witch
instructions: Combine blackcurrant liqueur and dry gin in a highball glass.
Top up with tonic water.
Add ice cubes.

name: Xepec Kaipiroska
ingredients: 8 ml (1/4 oz.) cane sugar syrup (simple syrup)
Half a lime, cut into quarters
instructions: Put 4 grapes and the quartered lime into an old fashioned glass, and mash with a pestle.
Add the remaining ingredients, including the ice cubes. Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with green grapes on a pick, and a wedge of lime.

name: Yellow Fizz
instructions: Place the strawberry slices in a wine glass containing ice cubes.
Add the white rum and passion fruit juice.
Top up with the tangerine-flavoured soda.
Stir gently using a mixing spoon.

name: Yummimosa
ingredients: 90 ml (3 oz.) no pulp orange juice
instructions: Pour the orange juice and grenadine into a shaker.
Add ice, shake thoroughly.
Pour into your glasses.
Fill with beer.
Garnish each glass with a slice of orange.
Recipe from Stéphane Morin’s book Panachés. Morin teaches sommellerie on top of being a beer historian.

name: Zephyr
instructions: Put the mint leaves, 3 cucumber slices, and sugar (or simple syrup) in a shaker.
Crush lightly with a pestle.
Add the vodka and lemon juice.
Crush everything again and stir to dissolve sugar.
Add ice cubes.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a martini glass using an ice strainer.
Garnish with a slice of cucumber.

name: Zest
instructions: Combine the hazelnut liqueur and lime juice in an old-fashioned glass containing a few ice cubes.
Stir using a mixing spoon.
Garnish with a few lime zests.

name: Zombie
instructions: Combine ingredients and ice cubes in a shaker.
Shake vigorously for 8 to 10 seconds.
Strain into a highball glass using an ice strainer.
Did you know:

Polynesian-style tiki culture was popularized in the 30s by a Hollywood restaurant called Don the Beachcomber. Exotic cocktails, vahines, statuettes, torches... all these stem from tiki culture, which even has its own architectural style! Some people claim that, like tiki statuettes, tiki cocktails have the power to protect you from harm. The Zombie, a drink invented in 1934 by the founder of Don the Beachcomber, is one of the most popular tiki cocktails.
